All Reviews

  1. There is nothing permanent about this product. I use it daily just to maintain. Cartridges have gone up in price, I buy two approximately every two months. So around $350 a year for cartridges. For me it's better than going in for hair removal treatments.
  2. Took forever to cover small area, used for 3 months and saw very little reduction in hair, still have to shave daily, fair skinned with dark hair
  3. I used this for four times and I lot of reduction in my hair growth, but cartridge runs out very quickly and this is a bad part.
  4. OMG!!! I love this machine. It does take some getting use to in the beginning, but you get use to the pain. I did the lightest setting the first time but was able to handle it on the third setting the second time. I did it for the third time a couple days ago on the fourth setting. I am already seeing results. I have really thick hair as I am mexican and native american. I have fair brown skin. What ever you do, do not get remotely close to your tatttoo if you have any, it hurts and will damage your tattoo. I didn't read that far in the instructions. Caused a blister and discolored the small part that I went over. I was able to get 3 uses out of one cartidge but I was able to do both full legs, bikini, and arms during each session. To replace the cartridge is super easy, I had no issues. It's important that you keep your skin moisturized after treatments, it's like having a mild sunburn, skin gets dry. I do a salt scrub after a few days exfoliate the skin. I haven't had to shave once in over a month. I use to shave my legs every other day. Well worth the time and investment.
  5. Never really worked and boke right after the month warranty. Complete waste of money. Wish I had listened to other reviewers.
  6. Light asian skin + dark hair ==&#62; WORKS! I have traditionally always used a epilator to remove unwanted underarm hair, but UGH, my hair grows so fast. If I'm being diligent, I need to epilate every 2-3 days to have clear underarms. Getting annoyed, I decided to give this IPL system a try.<br /><br />To begin, there is a learning curve to using this thing. My first time using it, I was just kind of a mess and probably went over the same spots several times by accident. The next day, hair was growing back and I was totally disappointed for having spent so much money. But, I didn't give up. To ensure that the thing was working, I shaved both pits but continued only IPL'ing one side for a more proper experiment.<br /><br />Now, it's been several times (at least 4x) on the one side and 1x (my first messed up try) on my &#34;control side&#34;, and the results are in! The 4x+ IPL side's hair has noticeably reduced! There is still hair growing there, b/c as you may know, hair grows at diff cycles, so I'm still probably zapping hairs that had a delayed growth cycle. Anyway, it's definitely noticeably different on the two sides, so I'm very pleased and glad I kept at it.<br /><br />Also, don't be discouraged if it's unwieldy to use at first. As I said, learning curve. After a few times, you start getting the hang of using it. Key is to be methodical. Hold -&#62; zap -&#62; move down -&#62; repeat. Never fully lift your hand as you're holding the IPL b/c you'll forget where you were.<br /><br />I use it on the highest setting. It is a little bit of pain, but really not that significant. I would recommend testing the highest setting and seeing if you can tolerate it. Better results, I would imagine.<br /><br />I am next going to try this on my bikini area, but I admit I'm a little scared haha. I have only ever waxed, and well, waxing is pretty easy for me and has pretty good and longish-lasting results (1-2 weeks)... but then again, 3 months does beat out 2 weeks by a lot!
  7. So far I haven't seen any results. I've been using for 3 weeks on level 4. I have the recommended skin and hair type for this machine. I read the instructions and watched the video. I'll keep it up for a few more weeks and if no results then I think I'm going to stick with the waxing.
  8. Using this device is VERY SLOW AND TEDIOUS. Does not appear to be very effective but perhaps it's too soon for results to show.<br />Would not recommend to a friend.
  9. I have used this as directed and have not gotten any results. Okay, maybe a [very] slight reduction in hair thickness. But that doesn't make any difference to me- either I have to shave daily or I don't. Well I still have to shave daily. For the record, I have very pale skin and the hair that I was treating is dark hair- so according to Remington, I'm the ideal candidate for this to work on. Waste of money.
  10. I love it! I have very course hair and yet it's working. I feel like a new woman. Tip to give, it's best to let the hair grow as much as you can stand it then shave and zap. Works best this way.
  11. I must admit that I bought this product fully expecting it not to work. I've tried my fair share of hair removal products and many simply do not produce the results they say. This however has actually reduced the hair very well with really not much aggravation.<br /><br />I'm not very good at using it regularly, so it would probably work better if you did. However, even with my sporadic use it has really made a noticeable difference. I hate shaving my bikini area because I get ingrown hairs which is why I purchased this. But part of the process is to shave, so I figured I'd just have to deal with it. I would say that after about 3 uses (again not consistently spaced apart), I have at least a 60 - 70% reduction in hair growth. The hair that remains doesn't cause me to get razor bumps when I shave, so the hair shaft must be weaker. Also, I haven't had to buy a replacement head yet, so that will give you some idea of the amount I've used it and the given results.<br /><br />I will continue to use this and give feed back. I definitely think it's worth the money. And the pain is tolerable, just adjust the settings. I've used it in very sensitive places and it's not that bad.
  12. I didn't have the results expected to the third time of using the product but is giving me positive results.
  13. I have to admit I thought that it would remove it completely fast but it takes a couple of flash sessions. What I do want to mention is that the bulb does not last as many flashes as indicated. The bulb is like forty dollars if you purchase it through the company I purchased it through amazon for eighteen dollars with in all beats going to a nail salon every other week and paying so much more. I can say that after the third session with the second bulb, I have seen that my hairs are not growing so much I hope after two more sessions that it doesn't grow at all. I will keep you posted. So with that said I love the product.
  14. I have used it three times and already have very little growth. I love not having to shave daily. Love it!

  16. It works. Labor intensive, but worth it. The 4 Star was for the fact that the cord wiring wears out. I have had mine for two years. Now, the fan will stop unless I jiggle the cord. TIP-Don't wrap the cord around the holder in the base. Causes stress on the cord.
  17. I went ahead and spent the money on the iLight, because I have very dark hair and have spent a fortune on waxing and shaving. I get very bad ingrown hairs that are awful after shaving or waxing. I did my bikini line 2 times on the 2nd setting. I must say I'm so surprised, there are areas where they hair is not growing back. JUST 2 TREATMENTS. I just did the 3rd treatment last night and I can't wait to see how much more hair disappears. I decided to do my underarms since I had such great results with the bikini area. Legs are next for sure. This product works as well if not better than advertised. You will not be sorry and it is well worth the cost. Much cheaper than having it done professionally and saves a ton on waxing. Buy it that's all I can say.
  18. I did a lot of research before finally deciding to buy this unit. I read all the reviews on it. I really liked the fact that the reviews are mostly positive and I really liked the price. I ordered it from Amazon and I received it yesterday and watched the video and read the little booklet on it before trying it out on a small test area. It is really easy to use. I am hoping it works. Unfortunately today when I went to use it it wasn't working so I called customer service. It pleasantly shocked me when a real live person answered the phone instead of dealing with an automated robotic menu and being put on hold. The customer service woman helped me to check the unit and see what the problem was. She determined I had a faulty unit. She was so very nice and helpful. They are sending a shipping label so I can return it and receive a new one. I understand that sometimes a faulty unit can happen but their customer service is really wonderful about trying to help solve the problem. I can't wait to receive a working unit after shipping this one back and I will update to let you know how it works.
  19. Do I still have hair growing on my legs? YES. Did it remove hair from my legs? Maybe. Yes, there are a few places where it seems that hair will never grow back again. I don't know if that is a good thing. This product is very expensive and for the price (I didn't pay for it) I would hope for a more impressive system.<br /><br />However, I do know that electrolysis is a lot more expensive so this may work for people with fine light hair more than it worked for me.
  20. I did a lot of research before buying this IPL. I think it's the best option considering price and cost of replacement cartridges. Also, it's very important to me that it can be used worldwide in terms of voltage, not just US voltage, so I can still use it when I move.<br />Now, as for ease of use, this couldn't be easier and it's very fast. I sit in front of the TV and in 15 min or less I'm done. In terms of pain it does hurt a little in some sensitive areas but much less than laser and for most of the process it's pain free for me even in the highest setting.<br />The reason I gave it a 4 instead of a 5 is because in terms of effectiveness I didn't find it to work exactly as claimed. If the description hadn't aimed so far I would have given it a 5 because in terms of hair reduction I'm very happy with the results. I have used it for 2 months, carefully following instructions, and I have seen a considerable reduction in the frequency of times I have to shave, but still very far from the 3-6 hair free months promised. For example, instead of having to shave my legs every couple of days now I have to shave once every two weeks or once every week if I want them really smooth. I think this is a pretty good result and if they had promised me this I would have still bought this item so I'm happy and would buy again.<br />I recommend this product, just don't expect too much and know also that in some body areas like the arms not even laser can remove hair completely for long.<br />I big plus also is that it doesn't hurt the skin even in the highest setting. I had some bad reactions to laser before but this didn't even cause redness.<br />It's a good product and if you buy it, be aware that it will reduce hair growth but is not miraculous.
  21. Update 4/13<br /><br />My wife decided to use it about six months ago when I quit. She has had good results with it. With her good results, I decided to use it again too. I assume her positive results depend on her hair type. Her hair is thinner than mine, thus \\"maybe\\" easier to zap???, thus kill the roots?<br /><br />I am not sure if this is a permanent solution, but she use to have ingrown problems while epilating. The zapping has eliminated this problem, thus based on that alone, she loves it.<br /><br />Old review:<br /><br />This product probably deserves two stars, because it does some-what work, but I figure people looking to buy this product will skim past the two star reviews and read the one star reviews.<br /><br />I bought this in December through a Groupon promotion for $199.00 and not on Amazon. I have read the reviews here for four months before posting. I basically agree with one poster MrD that some of these reviews (Ama***123, which happens to be the very first review) are fake, but most reviews are just from people who have not used this product long enough to give a good review. People need to use this product for a few months, not a few weeks or first or second session before posting, where their enthusiasm is clouding their judgement.<br /><br />Yes it works, if it didn't Remington would be sued. You will probably see 30% hair reduction after 3 sessions. Overall, maybe 40% to 50% reduction after a dozen or so sessions. The hair will start to grow back in probably a few weeks, not six months. The hair is just stunned, thus you will see the hair follicle on your skin.<br /><br />You have to ask yourself, what are you saving? If you shave, you will still have to continue to shave. 40% reduction for a few weeks will still leave you shaving daily. Is this worth the $250.00 price tag and $25.00 bulbs that seem to burn out at a few hundred pulses (not 1500 pulses and I am on my second bulb bought through Amazon.)? You decide.<br /><br />For the people who epilate, stay with epilating, the results are much better.<br /><br />For people who want permanent hair removal, go to a professional, it will be financially cheaper in the long run; especially when you are paying $100.00 a year for bulb replacements on a system that only give temporary results. Groupon always has 50% off professional laser treatment coupons.
  22. I've been using this product religiously for 7 months now. At first, I was VERY excited about the results. But reviewing this laser soon after purchase would be inaccurate at best. Here is why: You DO see great results after the first 2-3 treatments. Namely, not all the hair grows back. However, after 9-12 treatments, these results don't change drastically, and you will still have quite a bit of hair that requires shaving. In other words, you still must shave AS OFTEN as you did before, and it takes just as long as before to shave.<br /><br />At the end of the day, though I have less hair on my legs, the hair that does still grow on my legs requires shaving just as often as before. The fact that it's in patches or there is less of it doesn't make it OK to be seen in public with hairy legs! This device requires an inaordinate amount of time and quite a bit of $$. While I'll keep using it since I can't return it, I would NOT have bought it had I known it would produce such limited results.
  23. I am surprised that this item is only showing a 3.5 star average. The iLight is a great product. I have had pretty good results. I have gone through two cartridges since I have had my iLight. I did underarms, bikini, and lower legs. It took some of my hair longer to fall out than what is stated, but it does work. I had hairs coming out well after two weeks post treatment after my last treatment. I had some little tiny remnants that just hadn't come out, so they looked like black dots. I decided to pull at them with tweezers. They were way smaller than 1 millimeter (about the depth of a dime, very tiny). I have noticeably less hair, and my legs have almost none. Maybe about 20 hairs each? Not bad. My underarms have not been so lucky, but I believe that this is because I epilated about a month before receiving my machine and this hair growth phase hadn't yet become active. I am debating on whether to try and do touch ups in that area or whether to epilate.<br /><br />Now for the iffy.....The cartridges need work. As I mentioned before, I have used two cartridges. The first one came with the machine. I used it just over twice, and it gave out. I am 5'2\\" and my legs are not very large, so I couldn't have used that many pulses. I already had one on backup for just such an occurrence as I had heard that the cartridge that comes with the machine did not last as long as replacements. I got just under two treatments with the replacement cartridge. Please fix this Remington! This is an overall good product, but I can see how some people were put off by the quick failure of the cartridge.
  24. Laser hair removal is temporary. Lets say it one more time together, 'Laser hair removal is temporary.'<br /><br />That said every penny I have ever spent on it I've never regretted.<br /><br />I spent over $2,500 on salon laser hair removal (about two years of treatments, once every 8 weeks) and by the end of it I was hairless, nearly 100%, and anything that did grow was so fine and pale you couldn't even notice it. After about a year without it some darker stuff started to grow back, nothing like I used to have at all, but some stuff so I bought this as a touch-up to what I had already had done and it really feels about as intense as the machines that the pro's were using on me. I even tried it on some areas that I had never treated before and I'm really happy with the results. You have to do it every two weeks but beyond that this guy is great.<br /><br />Also, this really is a steal - I can't believe some reviewers are complaining about the price (of the device or the bulbs) - do a quick Google search for salon laser hair removal and trust me you'll come back to this product.<br /><br />Go on. I'll wait here.

  26. This review is based on my wife's feedback. She was very excited to review this product as she had just been researching and pricing professional laser treatment at the time this was sent. She's now been using this product every couple weeks for many months on some \\"select areas\\". She stated that the hair does seem fall out and it works but after all this time it doesn't grow back any thinner or different than before. The hair takes longer to return than shaving and it's not as painful as waxing but it's not the definitive answer to hair removal that she had hoped for. Once the device needs a new cartridge, I suspect it will be sentenced to a life on the closet shelf and it will be back to the razor. I guess a company like Remington wouldn't be in business too long if they actually stopped hair growth.
  27. I just recently purchased the I-Light Pro and I intend to use it on one area, while I will have professional laser hair removal done professionals on another area.I am currently undergoing 6 professional treatments of laser hair removal. I have done 2 so far. The I-Light package states that the I-Light is good for \\"6 months\\" of hair removal, whereas the the salon guarantees their work for 2 years... so we'll see.<br />I gave it 4 stars, because so far the I-Light has the same \\"sensation\\" as the professional laser treatment - however, I am using a higher setting (#4) on the I-Light, while I'm still at a very \\"low\\" setting when at the professionals. I do have a high pain tolerance, so neither one really hurts. It's a quick pinch when the light zaps.<br />I'm still shaving both areas, but have noticed that the hair density of both areas is going down. However, both areas still get a few ingrown hairs/bumps. It's a long process, but I hope to update this review in a few weeks with some results!<br /><br />**UPDATE**<br />5 months later: I'm changing my reviews to 1 star.<br /><br />I have been to a professional for laser removal for 5 of my 6 package sessions so far. I've been having one area done by the professionals and one area using the I-Light at home. Not even half of my hair is gone in the area being professional treated, even though they said when I prepaid for my sessions it should only take 3 sessions to start seeing a reduction in the hair. There are no guarantees, but I understood that going in. The professionally treated area has made the hair grow in finer and less coarse, but it's still there and you can still see it. And I still have to shave.<br /><br />However, I have seen absolutely NO reduction in the area I've been using the I-Light Pro on. I have been using it on the highest setting, which does give a bit of a 'zap/sting' that makes you think it's working, but I have seen no change in my hair quantity or thickness. I'm light skinned, dark hair, soI should be a perfect candidate... but it seems neither one is working for me!

  33. I have been using this product for more than 2 years and have been very happy with my Remington I-Light Pro. I have white skin and thick, dark brown hair. I originally purchased this to remove hair from my bikini area. Before owning this IPL, I would get bikini waxes at salons from time to time. I have really sensitive skin and shaving that area would result in bumps and inflamed skin. The bikini waxes were expensive, long, painful, uncomfortable sharing this intimate grooming experience with a stranger, and the results only lasted a few weeks. I wanted a hair removal system that would last longer than a few weeks and that is why I invested in the I-Light Pro. For me, the I-Light has been fabulous. The first time I used it, it was quite painful. However, it was no worse than a bikini wax. At first I used it on the lightest setting, but soon increased it to the strongest setting. You get much better results with the strongest setting. In the beginning, I would get some bumps a few days later. After a few uses, this got much better. For me, the I-Light did not completely remove hair for 6 months. Rather, it greatly reduces and thins the hair. Each time I use it, less hair grows back. And the more I use it, the less painful it is. Now that I have been using it for more than two years, it is nearly painless, even on the strongest setting (which I always use). Oh and how long does a cartridge last? Mine just expired after more than two years of zaps. I was zapping between one and two times a month. There was a period where I skipped more than a month of using the I-Light and a lot of my hair grew back. When I went back to using it again, it was a bit painful like it had been in the beginning. I think the reason that my hair starts growing back a few weeks later is because I have very thick, coarse, and stubborn hair. My guess is that if your hair is on the thinner side, your zaps will last longer. Even so, I am thrilled with my I-Light Pro. It takes two minutes every twoweeks and I am good to go. I recently started using it on my underarms and am pleased with the results. Again, it doesn't completely remove the hair, but it significantly reduces it. If you are looking for a better way to reduce and remove body hair, I highly recommend the I-Light Pro!
  34. I bought this for my daughter. I always say that she takes to long in the shower. She say, I got to shave and it takes time. She told me it takes about a month to work and she is really happy with it. From a mans point of view, cut shower time in half and its already paid for itself in water bill. :-) She is 17 and Italian enough said. Any questions will be past to my daughter. Great gift for the lady in your life.

  36. Update 5/5/15<br /><br />I'm on my third replacement cartridge. I've noticed more hair grows since I'm not as aggressive as I was with using this early on. I've been using this maybe twice in three weeks. There are spots that get streaks of hair that grows normally but I've let it grow long enough to know that it is way less than the volume of hair I would have naturally. Shaving to use this is the worst part, honestly, but that's not really a fault of this product.<br /><br />The upside of this is that this product makes hair removal almost worth the bother. Considering my track record with ingrown hairs there are certain areas I could never shave every day. My skin would be destroyed by all the ingrown hair bumps and scars if I tried. The fact that this products stops a lot of hair from growing really makes a difference in bothering to shave at all. Still happy with it.<br /><br />Update 3/23/15<br /><br />I've gotten halfway lax with using this. If I slack off for a week or two I have a light smattering of hair that is thin and barely grows and a few streaks of hair growing at a relatively normal rate.<br /><br />My second replacement cartridge is now about to die.<br /><br />I still need to shave but I have so much less growing hair now. The replacement cartridge thing is a bit of a pain, having lasted me like two months, but overall I'm still pleased with my purchase.<br /><br />Update 2/4/15<br /><br />I've only used this maybe once since the last review but allowed some time to pass. I really have to update my clearance percentage. I'd say 95% of the hair is not growing now. At least 80% has fallen out. I've started taking not having hair there for granted. Isn't that what you want, I guess? I think it's time to move on to a new spot. I'm really pleased.<br /><br />---<br /><br />Update 1/21/15<br /><br />I've used this roughly twice a week since starting my review, maybe 9 times now. My first cartridge gave out at the beginning of my 9th treatment.<br /><br />I'd say I'm maybe 70-80% clear of growing hair. There are a couple stubborn spots plus a smattering of a few hairs here and there that weren't affected. Later passes seem to catch the scattered hairs but the stubborn spots are resilient.<br /><br />I doubt this will ever entirely eliminate the need to shave but it still makes the area look much better after you do shave. It's a lot less dark and speckly in the area. It also keeps a smoother feel, overall.<br /><br />---<br /><br />...it's working! I've only used this thing three times and about 40% of the area seems to have hair that's fallen out or is at least stunted. I have almond-shaded skin (like the inside of an almond, for the spots that don't get sun, so pretty light) and dark brown to black hair (it's pretty much pitch black if it doesn't get any sun). I did all three treatments within two weeks rather than two weeks in between. The actual flash window is small, so it's hard to tell if you've covered everything. So even though the two week wait is probably to catch some of your hair follicles in a different growth period, I repeated much sooner just to have a better chance of having covered everything. I didn't burn myself or anything. Everything looks and feels fine.<br /><br />Tip: Pull you skin as taut as possible if you're treating an area that's squishy or has folds (armpits, etc.). You'll be surprised how much surface area there actually is to cover but the point is that the root of your hair will be much more visible through your skin if you pull it tight, hence it's easier for the flash to get to it. I noticed that hair that comes out diagonally from my skin has been affected sooner than that which grows almost straight out. I assume a greater length of root is shallow in the skin, therefore more easily affected by the flash.<br /><br />This thing is actually kind of fun. It hurts something like a cross between getting snapped with a rubber band and touching a light bulb sometimes but it's something that lasts a second, so it's halfway amusing, even. This isn't like an &#34;I touched a hot waffle iron with my bare hands&#34; kind of burn that's going to ache for days. At worst this has given me a pink spot of two that has been completely gone within hours and that was probably due to me double-flashing by mistake. However this is diminishing fast, a lot of it probably having to do with me having less hair in the area.<br /><br />Second Tip: If you have to shave a spot that doesn't like to be shaved in order to use this thing, maybe apply a skin product with Propylene Glycol (I assume I can't name brand names) and facial moisturizer after you've shaved and flashed the area. Shave cross-wise, not against the direction of your hair. Don't leave too much stubble, though, that's when it really hurts when you use this thing.<br /><br />I understand this product is not going to eliminate my hair 100% but even my current reduction of 5 o'clock shadow already makes the area look so much better. So far, I'm pleased. I may update on how far my hair reduction actually goes.d of burn that's going to ache for days. At worst this has given me a pink spot of two that has been completely gone within hours and that was probably due to me double-flashing by mistake. However this is diminishing fast, a lot of it probably having to do with me having less hair in the area. Second Tip: If you have to shave a spot that doesn't like to be shaved in order to use this thing, maybe apply a skin product with Propylene Glycol (I assume I can't name brand names) and facial moisturizer after you've shaved and flashed the area. Shave cross-wise, not against the direction of your hair. Don't leave too much stubble, though, that's when it really hurts when you use this thing. I understand this product is not going to eliminate my hair 100% but even my current reduction of 5 o'clock shadow already makes the area look so much better. So far, I'm pleased. I may update on how far my hair reduction actually goes.

I've only replaced the bulb once, using it on both legs, underarms and even the top of my toes, which takes me about 20 minutes. I use it on the highest setting and only in the most sensitive areas (behind the knees), does it hurt just a bit. I'm encouraged that if I keep doing this, eventually I won't have to shave at all. I'm very happy with this item, it's well worth the price.<br /><br />Update: I've used this a few more times over the summer and fall for a total of 11 months now.   46. I bought this to treat my underarms and bikini area because I'm tired of the constant battle with razor burn and ingrown hairs. I'm a prime candidate with very fair skin and dark hair. So far, I've completed 4 treatments over a span of 5 weeks (I got a little impatient towards the end and did not wait the full 2 weeks between.) I did all treatments on the highest setting, 5. It has now been 3 weeks since the last treatment, and here is my experience:<br /><br />Effectiveness - I'm seeing about 30% less hair in my underarms, and at most, about 10% less in bikini area. Not the results I was hoping for! Looks like this is going to take several more treatments.<br /><br />Pain - Hardly any at all! Just a brief flash of heat. My skin was not red or irritated afterwards.<br /><br />Ease of use - VERY easy and surprisingly quick. Took me about 5 minutes total to treat both underarms and bikini area.<br /><br />Quality - Here is my biggest concern. The first machine I had stopped working after about 20 pulses. All indicator lights green, just not flashing. I called support and had them send me a couple new cartridges, only to end up with the same problem. Finally figured out it was the machine itself that was defective, and called support to trade it in for a new one. (The process took about a week, since I had to ship the old one to them first. They provided the shipping label.) The new machine appears to work fine; however during my last treatment, the sensor that is supposed to beep when in contact with your skin inexplicably stopped working. I had to restart the machine a couple times before it began working again.<br /><br />To sum up: This product does work... eventually. And perhaps not fully. Depends how long you want to spend treating and re-treating the same areas. At the current rate, it will take the whole summer before I am \\"hairless\\" in the areas I want. And based on my experience and several other reviews here, I suspect my machine or cartridge will crap out on me before that point. Remington has a fantastic concept with the I-Light Pro; they just have some major work to do on improving their quality control.<br /><br />***UPDATE*** (a couple months later): I am changing my review from a 3-star to 1-star. After half a dozen more treatments on my underarms, bikini area, and lower legs, I've found that it's simply not having any effect. There were a few hairs it zapped in the beginning (mostly in the underarms) but now they have come back in again, and the other hairs continue to resist treatment. No wonder I hardly feel any pain. BOTTOM LINE... the I-Light Pro is nowhere near strong enough to compete with professional treatments and is certainly not worth the $250 I wasted on it.

NONE of which have given me hairless results. It may seem as though I'm obsessed with hair removal. However, I have VERY dark, VERY coarse hair in places a woman does not want hair. The different methods I've used have been painful, embarrassing, and a complete waste of time & money.<br /><br />I wanted to start with that because I know I'm not alone. A lot of women out there are experiencing the same thing and its holding them back from doing things they love such as swimming! What a process it is to prepare for a bathing suit when you have all this unwanted hair, unsightly razor bumps, ingrown hairs, stubble, etc.<br /><br />Words cannot even begin to express how happy I am with this machine! I feel the machine is more effective on the highest setting.<br /><br />Overall, this is an OUTSTANDING product...I couldn't be more pleased with my results! Had it ready to go right away and did both my problem areas in less than 5 minutes. If the head isn't positioned correctly, it won't work. You get used to hearing the beep that says its ready to go or press a little firmer/reposition it to get the contact correct. As far as any discomfort, at worst it was a 4 out of 10 on the highest setting. My underarms and the bikini area that faces front were completely painless.   54. I just received the Remington iLight Pro, and used it for the first time.<br />The machine doesn't look too fancy. It's small and lightweight and the plastic that it's made of doesn't seam very expensive.<br />The instructions are very simple, the machine is very easy to use.<br />I was very skeptical that such a small machine would be able to penetrate deep enough and with enough power into my skin to reach and burn the hair to it's root.<br />However, when I actually used the machine it felt like it was burning and it left red marks! I even smelled the burned hair smell which indicated that it's working!<br />I like that I can repeat this every two weeks, so I am planning to use it every two weeks for as long as I have any hair in unwanted places.<br />I do not expect this to permanently remove all my hair in 3 sessions that is absurd because even the professional treatments don't have those kind of results. But if I use this every two weeks , I expect to have very little hair regrowth which is better then shaving or plucking.<br />Be careful not to use setting 5 if you don't test that area of the skin on the skin sensor you might burn. This machine is very powerful!!!!!!!!!<br />It took me about 30 minutes to cover both lower legs.<br />All in all, I highly recommend this device because you can buy new cartridges for only 24 dollars, you can spot treat unwanted hair if you have already went to professional laser treatments and have hairs only in some areas, it's less expensive then going to a spa, it saves time, you can repeat every two weeks, you can zap single hairs on body, and it has a 2 year warranty in case it stops working. Good luck I hope my review helped.
  55. I have used the Remington Ilight Pro for two months - done four treatments. I have seen and felt a noticeable difference! Mostly, I notice that the skin on my legs is really smooth. I still get hair follicles that grow \\"through\\" - however, I don't have to shave as often, it's quicker when I do shave, and my skin feels super baby soft.<br /><br />I totally recommend it. Now, I have dark hair on my legs, but only moderate growth. So, it might work well for the dark hair relative to light skin. The lighter hairs above my knees don't seem to be disappearing as quickly. Though that hair is much more dense.<br /><br />It takes less than 40 minutes to do legs, underarms, and bikini line. I can watch a TV show while using the system. It doesn't hurt me at all on the minor setting and on the strongest setting, it feels like a little pinch. Nothing brutal and I can always turn it down.<br /><br />I am considering sharing the system with my family. We can all use it - because it only takes monthly updates, it's easy enough to pass around. Several of my friends have done other laser hair removal - professionally. At least one has had full regrowth in four years. Others have not yet had regrowth. Buy it. Worth the money!!
  56. I've only used it three times since it warns not to use it over once every two weeks. At this rate - if it works at all, it will take forever.
  57. I ordered this a little over a month ago and started soon after. When I went to do the 3rd treatment, the bulb only lasted a couple minutes. I do think I see some results from the initial treatments, but I'm not so sure I'm going to be continuing. I fear if I buy one bulb I'll have to worry it might not last, so I'll always need a spare around just in case. It's kind of frustrating because I see this problem with the bulbs popping up for a lot of people. Is this really so hard to fix? So even though I might get some results out of it(I'm not expecting miracles just reduction), do I really want to deal with this hassle, and worrying about faulty bulbs?
  58. I bought the Remington I Light pro 6 weeks ago based on a lot of research (and reviews.) This one consistently seemed to be the biggest bang for the buck so I bought it knowing that if it worked well I'd be investing in several more cartridges. I've done my lower legs, bikini area and underarms 3 times and my bulb has not failed me yet and I haven't counted exactly how many times I've clicked that little button but according to my calculations it's well over 1000 so I'm pleased. I am fair skinned and dark haired so I am the perfect candidate and I used it on the highest setting every time and the pain was way better than waxing so I was happy. That being said after 1 treatment I saw amazing results on my bikini area and little to no results on my legs and underarms. Now after the second treatment I noticed good results on my legs (more by touch then sight- even my hubby noticed :-) and minimal results on my underarms. I am not necessarily convinced that this is killing the root yet but that remains to be seen. I think it's important not to expect professional results. They can put professional in the name all they want but you're paying hundreds if not thousands less than professional treatments so take it for what it is. A reasonably price hair removal system that's not messy, not that uncomfortable, not too expensive, not that time consuming and seems to work pretty good over time. I will update this as I see more results. (And YES- I'm a real person who bought this thing without any kickbacks from Remington.)<br /><br />P.S.- Maybe it's just me but I think it may work better if you let it linger after it flashes for a second. It feels different when I do that which leads me to believe that helps. Plus it may reduce wear and tear on the bulb. I made sure to give mine breaks and I never got that overheat warning.
  59. I bought this to try to avoid the ongoing expense and trouble of waxing. The results have been great. Thinner hair, and less hair where I am using it, and I haven't had trouble with the bulb after two treatments to legs/underarm/bikini line as other reviewers report. It is not painful, like a rubber band snap for a second when it flashes sometimes (but not always) and I got used to it quickly. Not much difference for me between the settings so I am using it on the highest level most of the time to get best results. I have very sensitive skin (think red for 24 hours after a wax) but have seen no irritation or discomfort after the initial flash with this product on the highest setting. Really!<br /><br />Bikini line: OK results so far. I switched from waxing to shaving to use this so I think the results will be slower for me here as it will take time for the hair follicles to regrow so I can treat them. On the plus side, the treatments have been miraculous for ingrown hairs, a relief as I thought this would get worse with moving to shaving. Hair seems thinner and more sparse. It will take more treatments in this area because it's harder to follow the grid pattern which means missed spots. I think even if the hair removal results don't meet expectations I'd want to have this around to treat ingrown hairs if I go back to waxing. It seemed to hit some existing ones that were beneath the skin surface and make them go away.<br /><br />Underarms: great results. Noticeable less hair and I only needed to shave once last week. I exercise daily in sleeveless tops and was shaving every other day before. I really don't see stubble now for days.<br /><br />Legs: good results. It's a larger area and I tend to do this last, get tired, widen my grid and miss spots. But hair is thinner and sparser already.<br /><br />Two negatives: the handle is a bit awkward to hold and push down the button, and the pulses could be more frequent to move more quickly, particularlyover legs/larger areas, and as I got used to using it I could go quicker. Perhaps an option to adjust the frequency would be nice, like windshield wipers?<br /><br />Ordering a replacement bulb as I think I will hit 1500 pulses at next treatment and this is working well.
  60. After plugging in the unit and a very brief warm-up, you have to scan the body area to be treated for the unit to determine if the hair is light enough. This can be awkward, depending on what part of the body you're going to treat. Once this is done, the unit is very simple to operate. Place the head of the unit on the area to be treated, close one's eyes, and push the button. A very bright flash of light can be seen through closed eyes, along with a popping sound, and a mild burning sensation...which is the hair apparently being killed (feels like burned) to the base of the root. I did not care for the sensation. The manual indicates that at least two treatments are required to see much effect, and that the hair would gradually lessen in thickness/density. I did not get to the second treatment. Maybe others have a higher pain tolerance than I do. The process is slow and tedious, and it's difficult to tell which areas have been treated. Sunglasses recommended.
  61. I received this product in the beginning of March 2012. I am on my third session. After two sessions, I noticed the hair is re-growing slowly and becoming more like peach fuzz. I am giving this product 4 stars because it is difficult to determine where you zapped; this leads to a lot of overlapping. Also, you can't use this product in sensitive areas e.g. private areas of your body. I will provide another update in May, but so far, I am pleased with the item's effectiveness.
  62. ***UPDATE***<br /><br />After having the Remington for quite awhile now, I wish I hadn't bought it. The TRIA is far superior. I don't even drag the Remington out anymore because it's not worth the hassle. If I could afford a new TRIA, I'd buy a new one, but I'm stuck with my Remington. It does remove hair, but the results aren't as long-lasting as with the TRIA.<br /><br />***************************<br /><br />I give the Remington 4 stars. I thought it might be helpful for some if I share my thoughts on Remington vs. Tria for those who are trying to decide between the two.<br /><br />I had a Tria and I loved it. I bought it slightly used--big mistake. It died 9 months after the manufacture date, and since I wasn't the original owner, the company wouldn't help me, even though I offered to pay to have the battery replaced. So, it's now useless. I knew I needed a new device, but I was annoyed with how Tria treated me that I decided to switch brands altogether. The only alternative I found was the Remington I-Light Pro.<br /><br />The Remington isn't exactly a laser, but uses \\"ProPulse\\" technology. The Tria is marketed as a true laser hair removal system. Tria promises permanent removal/reduction, while Remington claims results will last 6 months.<br /><br />The Remington has a retro look, which I don't care for. I liked Tria's sleek, modern look, plus the fact that it was cordless. On the other hand, I won't experience the dead battery problems with my Remington, since the Remington is corded.<br /><br />The window (the part where the light flashes) is about twice the size as that of Tria, which means with the Remington I can finish an area in about half the time it took with Tria. This is a big plus.<br /><br />The Remington has a counter that keeps track of how many pulses you've used, so you'll know when it's getting close to time to replace the cartridge. Tria didn't have a counter and there was nothing to replace; when it died, it died. The counter on my Remington doesn't work, but I don't care because I'm not used to having one anyway. I like feeling like I have some way to keep the Remington operational by way of replacing the cartridge.<br /><br />Both devices have 5 intensity levels, so nothing new there.<br /><br />One annoyance with the Remington is that the flash is very bright, like a camera flash. I did my legs this morning and I felt like I should have been wearing protective eye wear. This was never a problem with the Tria.<br /><br />The Remington has a button you have to hold down to get the light to pulse. Tria would pulse on contact--no button. I have small hands and it's awkward for me to hold this button down, and my hand hurt by the time I was finished. Tria definitely wins out on this point, and if I could change one thing about the Remington, this would be it.<br /><br />I also dislike how difficult it is to reach the on/off switch on the Remington, but if it keeps my 6-year-old from switching it on accidentally, I'll take it.<br /><br />Tria's cool-down system was bothersome, as it would switch on and off during use and cause the laser to be sluggish. Remington's fan stays on constantly and there's no drag, so that's much better.<br /><br />Tria had a separate skin-tone checking device, whereas Remington's is built in and awkward to use. It's not a big deal, since I just always put my hand on it instead of the body part I actually intend to treat. (I'm breaking the rules, I know, but what was Remington thinking by designing the tester this way?)<br /><br />I'll update this when I get a better sense of my results, but I was already several months into my treatment with the Tria, and so I'm not starting with untreated hair. My sense is that I'll get as good or better results with the Remington.
  63. So I bought this product under the assumption that it would work directly out of the box. Wrong. I hooked it up, followed the manual to a 'T', and it never ever flashes. I unlocked the system just as it said and when holding down the flash button, nothing happens at all. No flash. I sent Remington an e-mail asking what I should do to fix the device but got no response from customer support. So, based on what was written in the manual, I decided to purchase a spare cartridge under the assumption that maybe the unit had shipped with a defective one. Another $30 wasted.<br /><br />Don't buy this. Quality control from China is non-existent. I basically have a $300 piece of plastic that I can't return. Funny thing is, I would have settled for a replacement unit had they actually responded to my e-mail...

  66. The instructions say to do 3 sessions, with 2 weeks in between, and then maintenance as needed. It took me 6 sessions, 2 weeks between each. It has been 2 weeks since my 6th session, and there is not a single hair on my bikini line. This is amazing. If you go to a spa, they usually make you wait 6 weeks between the 6 sessions. So rather than go to a spa, wait 30 weeks, and pay so much money, it only took me 10 weeks, and was way cheaper. I did 6 sessions on my bikini line, 6 on my underarms, and have done 3 on my lower legs so far and the original light cartridge is still working. I really didn't have high hopes for this, but it really does work.<br /><br />Update: It's been 3 weeks since the 6th session, and the hair is starting to grow back, enough to be noticeable. Not so happy now.<br /><br />2nd update (2 weeks later): Hair is still growing back. Something is also wrong with the machine. I used to be able to use it on the highest setting, now even the lowest is unbearably painful, feels like I'm getting poked with a hot knife. I tried it in areas I have never done before, and it's still unbearable, so I know my skin isn't just sensitive from overuse. Can't use it anymore, huge waste of money.
  67. I bought this product based off the good reviews and I'm glad I did! I have used it on my underarms 3 times 2 weeks apart and I have an 85-90% reduction in hair growth. I have really pale skin and dark hair and I had really bad undergrowth but not anymore. I listened to the other reviewers and bought back up replacement cartidges. It has ran out of charges during my treatment but I just wait 5 min for the machine to cool down and replace the cartidge and I'm good to go! I have purchased 2 replacements so far. I also use it on my stomach area which is why I have used so many charges. I have noticed a difference on my stomach but have not had the same results as on my underarms, maybe because the hair texture is different? But I still have seen results (slower growth time, finer hair, & maybe a 30% hair reduction) Overall I am very pleased with my purchase!

  71. I love this thing. I am of Italian descent and have the dark thick and plentiful hair to go with it. I used to shave daily and would start feeling the razor sharp stubble within hours. It definitely took some practice and it definitely took a few sessions ( a session meaning a 30 minute or so treatment every other week over six weeks) before noticing the lasting results. Read the manual and watch the DVD - you'll be glad you did. The first treatment stung a bit, but after a few times I can crank that baby up to full power and it barely hurts (remember the first time you tweezed your eyebrows? Same sorta thing.) I've been using it about 18 months now and really happy with the results.<br /><br />It says this on the box, in the description, etc. but it only works with dark hair and lighter skin. The first time I tried it my legs were pretty tan and didn't get as good results as parts of my body that don't see the sun (abs, etc.) Subsequent treatments worked fantastic and I could shave 2x a week instead of daily and the regrowth was fine and soft - not hard stubble. Being able to shave while using this (in fact you have to use it on freshly shaved skin) is great - unlike waxing where I felt like a beast while it was growing out.<br /><br />I found the results from the I-Light lasted 3-4 months until I started noticing not only the need to shave more frequently but also the regrowth starts getting thicker. But then I do another session and I'm good for another 3/4 months. But over time the hair on my thighs has barely come back and I am noticing the regrowth on my lower leg is 30-40% less than before.<br /><br />So IF you follow the directions, and you fit the profile for being a good candidate for it (e.g. dark hair/light skin), and you realize this is not a permanent hair removal system and are ok with that - well worth the $$.
  72. First off, you cannot expect a device that costs under $200 to be comparable to professional laser treatment with a machine that costs thousands of dollars. For the price, this is worth it, under certain conditions. I have fair skin and very dark hair. This only worked (so far) on thick hair. I've been randomly using it for a couple of months. I was able to \\"permanently\\" remove random thick hairs in places (like my big toes) and reduce the hair in my bikini area. I have already had professional laser treatment there, but wanted to reduce some of what I had left untreated. I think using this on max is about as powerful as the first couple of low-level professional treatments at best. I used to have to shave my bikini area every day to avoid coarse stubble. So far, after about four treatments (about a week or two apart), only some fine hair grows back. This is okay since I need to go back to get a professional touch-up anyway (some fine hair is growing back in areas where I had professional treatment). That way they can touch up the entire area at a high setting. If it weren't for me using this, they would have to do a low setting for the \\"virgin\\" hairs and a higher setting for the previously treated areas. They might not be able to do that. They would probably just do the whole area starting on the low setting. I tried it on my legs, but am not sure it is working very well. One good indicator of that is that it doesn't hurt at all when it flashes; so I'm not very optimistic. It does seem like it's not growing as quickly and maybe it's getting rid of the thicker hairs. I'm going to keep at it. I bought a couple of spare cartridges anyway. I had to, since the one that came with it was a dud. It lasted about 20 flashes. This is the only reason I knocked off a star. I didn't want to bother with customer service; I probably could have gotten a replacement for free, but I just ordered it myself with Prime shipping in order to avoid the chance of having to wait. So they way I figure it, I at least saved myself the cost of one or two professional treatments on the way to \\"permanent\\" removal as well as permanently (so far) removed coarse hairs in small areas that I would have never paid for professional treatment. I'm going to keep at it with the finer hairs and if I get any results I will edit this review. Also, you don't need to buy eye protection for this. It specifically says so in the directions. I still try not to look directly at it when it flashes.

Once home from the trip, I've basically left things alone to measure any progress. To my surprise, just in the last week or so, I've noticed many tiny hairs are just falling out! I think it took my follicles longer than most, but 3 to 4 weeks later, I'm experiencing what the device promised.   82. Update 9/7/12<br />Well its been past six months and I can say that this is not permeant! It does what it says, gets rid of hair for a few months, but all of it grows back, all of it.<br />I think with what I know, I would have rather spent the money on profesional permanent hair removal. Just for the record again, all , every single hair has grown back. The product does do what it says and it does not say that it is permeant so I decided not to dock it any stars since it has done what it said. Im just disappointed all the hair grew back.<br /><br />--------------------<br /><br />Update 6/29/12<br /><br />Well the spots on my arm did I did are still hair free, so im having to shave my arms all the time so they don't look strange. I haven't done my chest in a few weeks and let that and my stomach grow out. I would say this is definitely reduction. But it hasn't done as much as I originally thought. My stomach is still pretty hairy but the hair has been reduced. The test spot on my neck I did a few months ago is still hair free, and I did my neck a few times, and I now have spots the size of an pencil eraser with no hair, randomly.<br /><br />I think for the face/neck, id recommend laser and not to mess with this device there.<br /><br />I've noticed that tiny hairs are growing back (not as thick) in some areas that were hair free before.<br /><br />Overall: This thing does what it says, hair reduction, but don't expect permeant results. It does seem to make allot of hair grow in thinner, and some hair isn't returning (so far). It would be nice if it was permeant, but its not.<br />----------------------------------------------------<br /><br />Ok, so for almost 3 month now. My chest is 80% hair free now. My stomach is 50%. I'm starting to use it in other places hoping for similar results. I am still on the orignal bulb, and I don't know how many zaps im on now.<br /><br />Overall its a slow process to remove the hair completely. Its still pretty painful when the thing strobes, I don't know why they say it would be pain free, the more concentrated the area with hairs the more painful it will be.<br /><br />Since the hair hasn't started growing back yet im pretty happy.<br /><br />Update 5/27/2012<br /><br />-------------------------------<br />I upgraded this to 5 stars because its super effective on my hair so far. I am hoping its permeant, but I won't know until 6 months from now.<br /><br />I tried zapping a area on my neck, to see what would happen. That area is hair free now, but it HURT! I've got a full beard worth of stubble and a small patch with no hair, even though the instructions do say not to use on the face. I am semi considering trying it, because I hate shaving my face (Im a male if you haven't figured that out).<br /><br />I am thinking of doing my arms and legs next. I mostly just wanted to do my chest and stomach, as I don't like to be a woolly manath when swimming.<br /><br />I think im on the 5th or 6th week. I have some areas that are completely hairless except areas where the flash thing didn't go. My stomach is still has quite a few hairs, but im working it down, I am seeing results after each time I do it. My chest is almost hair free. I've noticed I have this \\"sunburnt\\" burned feeling in my chest, where the hairs were, like a little bit inside.<br /><br />Im still on the orignal bulb and I haven't had any problems with the machine. Im kinda trying to figure out how some of you say you used the entire bulb your first 2 weeks...<br />Update 4/30/2012<br />-----------------------------------------------<br />First time use:<br />I tried it level 1 -5 on a test patch of skin and waited 24 hours. No negative reactions or redness. The next day I did my chest and abs area at level 5.<br /><br />Week 1:<br />All the hair grew back, no changes, felt disappointed at first and thought maybe it wasn't working.<br /><br />Week 2:<br />I have spots where there is no hair growth. So it seems some of the hair has fallen out. I just shaved my chest and abs again, zapped them again. I'd say the hair thats gone is maybe 1/3 an inch of clear skin every where I zapped the thing. Some of the hair that was in the window when getting zapped grew back like nothing happened. The test patched that I tried levels 1-4, all grew back with no hair loss, the test patch i did level 5 had some hair missing. I did my entire chest and abs with level 5 the two weeks ago, and its missing some hair, which leads me to believe that I need to highest setting for any results at all.<br /><br />As far as pain, it does hurt a little bit. It kind of feels like a rubber band and an electrical shock hitting where the hair grows. The machine also has a fan in the hand piece that sounds like a computer fan when its running.<br /><br />I don't know yet if this is permanent or just temporary. I've heard it just \\"stuns\\" the hair to some people saying the hair never grew back.<br /><br />Update:<br /><br />4/12/12<br />Week 3/Week 4<br /><br />Well, im only using this on the highest setting, I wish it was a bit more powerful as to be sure its killing the hairs. So far, the places I've zapped, the \\"window\\" or \\"area\\" that was zapped, about 1/2 the hair grows back and the other half is gone. On my chest and stomach area, its still quite hairy, Its looking like this is going to take a long time before its completely hair free. About the pain from the hairs getting zapped. It hurts. I've found my self not wanting to use this because of the pain. But so far this device has been really effective in removing the hair in the areas im targeting.<br /><br />I wish the company would approve this for the face, I've noticed other IPL systems in europe are approved for using on the face. I don't know if its just the flash and their worried about that, or if the light damages facial skins, I don't know, but I would really like to try this on my face after seeing the results from my stomach and chest.<br /><br />So far, I am still using the orignal bulb. I don't know how much life is left. When I use it I just go over a broad area, maybe like 15 zaps on my stomach and 10 on my chest, I can't really see the hair after I shave it, so I kind of have to wait after I zap it and it falls out to see where I have hair left. Also I can't tell when I've zapped an area because this thing does leave any marks, and I don't want to rezap an area.<br /><br />But over all this thing has been super effective on the hairs that have fallen out. I guess I would say when I zap an area, the hairs that fall out cover the area of a pencil eraser or two put together and then the rest of the area the hairs regrow. So, thats why I think it might take a while. Again I am not sure if the hair is stunned and will grow back or if its permeant. In the areas where it really hurts, and it smells like burned hair, I seem to have the largest results. In other areas, it just feels really warm with out the rubber band being snapped on my skin, and I don't have any results in those areas. So far I am pretty happy with this device, even with its high cost.<br /><br />I keep checking back here to read the reviews, and noticed quite a bit of people not happy with it, which does kind of worry me. But so far im happy with it, I did buy it expecting it to not really work, and so far it is, so I am happy with that.
  83. Well, I had a complete hair removal IPL treatments 2 years ago, and it significantly reduced my hairs (compared to how it was before), but for almost $3000! I have a white skin and used to have really thick/dark hairs compared to my skin color, and getting rid of them was an absolute pain and waste of time with all those damn blasters and under-skin hairs after shaving or waxing! I had tried every possible way and hair-removal products but nothing worked better that those IPL treatments. However, everybody knows that nobody guarantees a permanent hair removal even with IPL or laser, so my hairs re-grew to some extent after almost 1.5 years, but I did not want to spend another thousands bucks to redo hair removal.<br /> I was really surprised when I saw this home-version IPL online. I went over the reviews and found that this little thing works but not probably as quite well as professional hair removal instruments. I took the chance and purchased it, and I can confidentially say that it was one of the best decisions and purchases I ever made. :) Yes it works. What is better than a flexible almost-permanent self-hair removal? I even tried it on some areas of my face and under chin with the lower energies (with special care to my eyes), and it did the job :). I saw obvious results after the second treatment, (it could have been the first but since I was new to it I decided not to go for higher energies at the first time). You just need to have patience and one hour or so (depending on the treatment area) every 2-3 weeks. And then just see how your hairs start to loosen, fall off, and get reduced. Besides, you always know that this little friend is with you as long as you take a goof care of it and can do the job whenever the hairs come back. Just spend $250, follow the instruction, and enjoy your hair-free/reduced body. :) Thanks Remington for such a life/money saver. :)<br /><br />P.S: The light cartridge needs to be replaced after 1500 shots.   86. May 15, 2012<br /><br />I have used laser for two years, in a total of 15 treatments. But the remaining treatments were performed by good centers, and all I have now in the areas treated is some baby hair.<br /><br />Some people in the area of hair removal say that laser is better for coarse hair, and ipl is better for baby hair. So I decided to give this a try. This ad may be clearly misleading for so many different reasons. First, it does not even tell us the level of energy used, but still refers that the levels of energy are comparable to clinicians' levels... Second, all the pictures/ video clips of the results are probably based on results that one can see only in extremely responsive patients. In my case, my expectations are low: I just want to be able to shave and don't see my hair getting coarser. That's all, and that's the only reason I bought it, granted that most home devices tend not to be as effective as the devices in clinical offices, mostly for safety reasons.<br /><br />I just tried it.<br /><br />It is easy to use in fully accessible areas (therefore the 4 out of 5 stars). You have to place the device properly on the skin, you will hear a beep and only then you can \\"shoot\\". So if the area is not fully accessible by you, either you don't do it well or you ask someone to do it for you.<br />I used the highest level of energy, since I am used to laser hair removal. It is less painful than the professional YAG laser, it burns the hair. It does not leave any much redness. All this suggests that it is not equally effective to the clinics' IPL, but let's wait and see.   92. This item works - and depending on your coloring and hair type, it can work quite well. Just don't expect \\"magic\\" and instant results from a home-use item. I have found it works best if you put it at the highest level only - you waste less time and use fewer charges this way. Also, I have very fair skin and very dark body hair - purportedly the best combination for treatment.<br /><br />In the beginning, I treated some areas (arms and underarms) once a week. Then lengthened the time between treatments to two weeks, or three - now once every other month - and even then, the hair that returns is far finer and lighter and so far less noticeable. One of the reasons it has worked so well on my arms and underarms is because I had never epilated those areas - i.e. those hairs had only been shaved (or bleached for the arms). However, even my lower legs (repeated use of epilator) don't grow back as quickly as I would have expected. It is not as successful on my abdomen - which, from the beginning, had sparser, finer, and lighter hair. Mixed results on facial hair (and it explicitly says it's not for facial use - because the average, ignorant individual will burn themselves or harm their vision and then sue the company). Essentially, hairs that have been plucked or epilated or removed in that fashion will be more resistant and require more treatment. Hairs that are darker and thicker will be removed more effectively. It can take some time to use, depending on how much hair and how many body parts you want to use it on. However - for those of us who can't drop the $ having their bodies professionally treated, this is an extremely useful home system. I'd far rather use this once every other month - even every month if it occasionally proves necessary, rather than constant shaving. The results are long lasting, and you don't get a stubbly regrowth.<br /><br />Mine worked excellently for 4-5 months (I can't recall exactly) and then suddenly stopped. I called the company,not sure what to expect since I had let the thing sit for at least 5 months after purchasing it before I even tried it, and so was close to 1 year warranty. There were no questions or hassles - they sent me a pre-paid shipping label within about a week, I returned the broken system, and received a brand-new one shortly thereafter. I'm a happy camper.

  97. I purchased the Remington i-Light Pro from another site (lower price). This does exactly what it says in 3 to 6 treatments, spaced about 2 weeks apart. Be advised that the remaining hair in the follicle will gradually work its way out of the pore. It appears that your hair is growing, but it is not. There will always be a short hair remaining under the surface of the skin that the body will expel naturally. Also, remember that each follicle normally has 3 hairs that grow from it - hence the 3 treatments 2 weeks apart. You can do it sooner than 2 weeks, if you are like me and your hair grows very fast. Just shave and treat again. You will have to be vigilant to see the positive results of this product. But if you are, you will be rewarded with smooth skin in a short period of time. The effects generally last 6 months (per the website and the brochure), however, mine lasted for about 4.5 months. As I said, my hair grows crazy fast! But to not have to shave for 4.5 months instead of EVERY day!? That is like being in heaven!<br /><br />The i-Light Pro is the cheapest product of its kind, others go for $299.00 and higher. I am sure they work as well, but why pay more? The replacement cartridges are also much cheaper with this model.<br /><br />Be sure to shave before using the Remington, it will burn the hair and therefore burn you if you do not!<br /><br />Replacement bulbs can be ordered from Remington.com for $24.99 each.

  102. Remington IPL6000USA I-Light Pro, Professional IPL Hair Removal System<br /><br />When I saw this hair removal system on the vine list, I was intrigued. As for the machine itself I used anywhere between level 1-3 because I thought it was a bit painful when I began.   105. I've had quite a bit of success with this hair removal system. I had previously had about 8 professional laser hair removal treatments - but needed more - so opted for the home version. It is definitely A LOT weaker than the professional unit but it's still effective. I've noticed considerable hair reduction. I use it on the highest setting and it's hardly painful at all - until you get to specific super sensitive areas - then it hurts. When it hurts- it's like a combo of very very hot and a rubber band sting at the same time. It's very time consuming and takes months and months to see results. Like I said I had 8 professional treatments and still needed more - so don't expect quick miracles with a home unit! I've also gotten very good life out of the light cartridge. Way more than I expected after reading the reviews. I did my full legs 3 times, armpits & bikini area about a dozen times each --- all with 1 cartridge before it died and needed a replacement. The price on amazon is very good - I did find it at ulta with a coupon for a better deal though. I think at just $25 a pop for the replacement cartridges it's a pretty reasonable & effective home hair removal.

  107. I bought the Ilight through Remington's Groupon promo last December. I have had professional laser hair removal on both my underarms and bikini area, so I can give an honest comparison here. I bought the Ilight to do my legs because I didn't want to shell out big bucks at a professional laser place for a \\"large\\" area. I have a tattoo on my leg which I have had to avoid through the process because of the dark pigmentation (I accidentally got too close with the laser once and blistered myself. Ouch.) soI have a \\"test patch\\" for comparison as well. I've done my legs 4x, plus a couple of treatments to try to maintain the pro hair loss on my underarms and bikini and I've purchased 2 bulbs in addition to the one that came with the unit. So I've burned through 2 and am working on the 3rd.<br /><br />I noticed a pretty big difference after the first 2 treatments, 2 weeks apart. The results were less drastic and harder to notice the 3rd and 4th time. I have very fast growing hair; before the iLight if I shaved in the morning I'd have a visible \\"5 o'clock shadow\\" by night. My 4th treatment was 2 weeks ago, and at this time I can shave every other day. Today is my 3rd day without shaving. I can definitely see some patches of hair here and there if I look closely and it feels a bit stubbly but I'd still wear shorts and no one would know unless they looked very closely. The untreated tattooed area is much hairier and the hairs are thicker and closer together. Over all I'd say the treated areas have about 40% less hair. My plan is to do sessions once a month from here on out for maintenance. As far as value goes, I'm happy with being able to shave 1/2 as often and have the hair be less noticeable when I don't. I definitely feel less like a beast. Yeah, I was hoping for better results, but a $20 cartridge every few months after the initial $199 isn't so bad for being able to skip shaving half of the time. We do a lot of boating, and before the iLight I carried adisposable razor and dry shaving lotion with me. No joke.<br /><br />So how does it compare to professional laser hair removal? I saw big results, faster. But the hair still regrew. After 5 pro treatments on my bikini and underarms, I still have to shave. There was only a brief period after the 4th treatment or so where I seemed to be nearly hairless. Then there was a flush of hair, I had one more treatment and and gave up because the price was prohibitive and the hair kept coming back. There was no way I'd be done after a sixth treatment, which is what most laser centers advertise. I spent $500 and that was with a deep discount.<br /><br />Is the iLight going to make you completely hairless? No. But if you, like me, had to shave every day like I did, you might not have to anymore. Are you going to have to shell out $20 for a new cartridge every few months once you get to the \\"maintenance\\" phase? Yep. Is it worth it, IMO to have legs that don't start feeling prickly an hour after I shave them? You bet. Just have realistic expectations. I'd buy it again.<br /><br />Oh, and jack the thing up to it's max flash when you use it. You only get so many flashes and you'll get more bang for your buck. Yeah, it hurts. Especially on sensitive areas. But so does waxing.

  112. Yes, I had to see it to believe it. This is an essentially painless and effective hair removal system with long lasting results. I have coarse dark hair that would grow back very quickly after shaving. I always hated to shave and would almost always end up with a shaving rash. Lately, the rash had been getting worse, so I started trying cream hair removers. Everything I tried seemed to cause skin irritation, no matter how hypoallergenic or gentle the label promised. When I found this system, I researched it for weeks before I purchased it. I thought the testimonials were too good to be true. But, out of desperation, I purchased it, along with a replacement cartridge. You can do about one and one half treatment cycles with the first cartridge, so it is a good idea to order a replacement cartridge so that you can complete the total six week treatment cycle. Just shave your legs, pop in a movie, and do the treatments once every two weeks for three treatments. It really is painless, easy, and effective. What else can I tell you? I even have a great bikini line for the first time since I started shaving (even though I am past the age where a bikini is appropriate...at my age, it would be more like a boo-kini...to quote my daughter). So if you are sick of shaving your legs and underarms, try this. Don't order it if your skin is too dark, or if your hair is blonde or gray. It only works for golden to pale skin tones with dark hair follicles. Read all the precautions and warnings before ordering or using.
  113. With shaving then using this my skin is behaving better, and not getting ingrown hairs nearly as often.<br /><br />Plus I get to do this in my home, while my son is asleep!!!!<br /><br />I get that it isn't professional results, because I am doing this weekly. But I do three areas and I am done easily under an hour. I do put seabreeze on my skin once I am done, but that is just to help prevent ingrown hairs after the shaving (dont put anything on your skin before doing the laser, I do it once I am dry out of the shower). But for the price and convenience it is well worth 200 bucks. My sister is going to get one this summer b/c I have loved mine!!<br /><br />Watch the prices here on amazon and it will drop back down to right above 200 dollars, get one and you will never look back!!!
  114. I have been waiting to post this review until I have had a chance to use the product for some time. I bought this because I had starting getting ingrown hairs after I would shave my legs and armpits. I have used this probably three times on my legs and maybe ten or so on my underarms. I have noticed significant hair reduction on my legs and a slight on my underarms. I still get ingrown hairs every now and again but not like I was. I use it on the highest setting and my skin is considered fair with yellow undertones. My facial concealer is named fairly golden and I tan very easy if that helps. Also, my hair was not that thick to begin with but I can go a lot longer between shaving my legs that I did before. The cartridges are not the best but I will not complain because had I gone to a clinic, I would have paid a lot more.

  117. I received my I-Light on Christmas Eve and just exhausted the first cartridge. I was able to complete 3 full treatments on the legs, arms, and bikini, just as advertised. The machine is very easy to use and they provide ample cord length. The only problem that I had was the initial unlocking of the machine with the skin tone sensor. It is winter in Ohio and I am quite literally the lightest skin color on the guide! I am not scanning over any moles or dark areas and am using in a well lit bathroom. With my initial excitement, I overlooked this issue. As my use has continued, it has become much more frustrating. It sometimes requires 10 or 20 scans just to unlock the machine for use. I contacted Remington and they sent a prepaid shipping label to exchange for a new machine. I'm anxiously waiting for my replacement to arrive as I am starting to see results! There is about 30% less hair on my legs, one armpit has 50% less hair (on the other armpit 40% is growing very slowly), no obvious change yet on the bikini area. Assuming no problems with my exchanged unit and continued results, I'll be updating to a 5 star rating. The price is exceptional, and you have the privacy of treating yourself in the convenience of your own home! ***UPDATE*** 2/12/12 My exchange with Remington went flawlessly and the new/repaired unit is working perfectly. It has unlocked every time with my first scan. I haven't had the remarkable results that some report (according to Remington, in clinical trials after 3 treatments there was an average reduction of 47.8% at six months). My hair reduction is probably closer to clinical trial results vs those reporting not shaving after one treatment. I am not disappointed with the progress; I just want future users to have realistic expectations. Also I've been thinking about how to direct future treatments once my hair is more sporadic and here is my idea so far. Allow the hair to grow out a bit so I can clearly see which areas need further treatment, outline with a white eyeliner pencil, and then shave those spots with an electric razor. This will give a clearly defined treatment area, using an electric razor you can be sure to preserve the outlines, and the white eyeliner shouldn't attract the light energy. I'm not far enough along that it is an issue yet, but with the progress I'm making, I expect to be by the end of my 2nd cartridge!
