  125. I've had this product for a couple months now at least, and have used it primarily for my arms, shoulders and back (with some use on my upper chest).<br /><br />I have very thick, dark hair, and my skin varies in certain areas (farmers tan) and I didn't notice any real changes in usefulness based on that. I started by doing as it said by using the system in 2 week intervals, at the end of 6 weeks, I've noticed less hair in certain areas, and some areas where it seems to not be successful at reducing hair at all. I've spent a good time since \\"touching up\\" the same areas, and with persistence I've started to see real results.<br /><br />As far as the pain goes.. some areas where the hair is longer or I had more of a concentration, it really hurts on the highest setting. It wouldn't burn my skin or anything like that, but there was a lot of redness afterwards. If you are sensitive I would suggest getting the gel or maybe icing the area.<br /><br />Bulb usage has been good, I bought an extra bulb and haven't had to replace it, and I've done my back, arms and shoulders for at least a couple months now, as well as allowed my friends to try it and I think I've gotten way more use out of this bulb then I expected based on the reviews.<br /><br />Only other thought... looks like the lens can get pretty dirty so make sure you clean it right after every use. With the results I've gotten, I'm not hairless like I expected by this time, but I see a lot of improvement, so if you're the kind of person who can stay vigilant, I would say this is well worth the buy.

  127. **UPDATE** (4/28/14)<br /> What can I say? I started Nursing school so I set this aside for a while, and I totally noticed when it got to my 6 month time. Since then I have used it for a second round. I just use it here and there now, but I try to hit myself at least once a month to keep the growth from coming back like it did before. It didn't grow DIFFERENTLY, I just got really use to thinned, slowed growth. =/<br /><br />Not seeing any damage to my skin or anything. No overly sensitive areas, no lightening of the skin. No burns, no scarring, etc etc...<br /><br />I am still happy with the product. =)<br /><br />****<br /><br />Hey there everyone!<br /><br />This is going to be a review for the remington i-light pro premier intense pulsed light hair removal system.<br /><br />I am medium skin toned (I got tanner as this went on because it is summer and I tan easily) and my hair is dark brown.<br /><br />TL;DR version: This system worked for me. After the 3 first treatments I have seen slowed hair growth and less appearance of hair. The real results won't show up (according to the book) for 1-2 months after those first treatments because the hair has to work its way out, so if I remember, I will update later.<br /><br />Now the rest...<br /><br />I am going to encourage conversation here... please, ask me questions. When I was debating on purchasing this system, I really would have liked someone to speak with about it. Just leave a comment and I will do my best to keep up with them.<br /><br />Now, up front, I AM NOT a product reviewer. I didn't get this system for free to use. I spent my own hard earned money on this. (which is why I was desperate for an honest review... and for the most part I wasn't finding any-- when I see the same review, word for word, on the remington site, walmart, amazon, etc... I know it isn't a true review. -_- )<br /><br />So this is an honest review from me. I went into this very, very non-optimistic. This was my last resort before going to a professional salon and sinking in the big bucks for hair removal. I have used every cream, buffer, razor, etc on the market with no results. (and in some cases, painful results. Some of those creams are no joke.)<br /><br />Q. Where did I use the remington i-light pro premier intense pulsed light hair removal system?<br /><br /> Well... I won't lie. I went and bought this system almost 100% for my face. That was my driving force behind it, even though I *KNEW* this system was not designed for my face.<br /> I figured I may as well go full monty and use it on my legs, bikini area, and underarms while I was at it. I used a 3 on my face, and a 5 on the rest of my body. The 3 was enough for my face since there are a lot of sensitive areas there. My personal recommendation, if you use it on your face, go with a lower zap and wear eye protection. And don't go above the cheek bone or use it on your eyebrow area. KEEP IN MIND THAT REMINGTON, AS A COMPANY, DOES NOT ENDORSE THIS. I WILLING USED THE SYSTEM THIS WAY, DESPITE WARNING. I don't want anyone thinking that what I did was acceptable, but if you CHOOSE to do it, be as safe as possible.<br /><br />Q. Was the remington i-light pro premier intense pulsed light hair removal system hard to use?<br /><br /> About my only complaint is that the system is kind of bulky. But that is all. It turned on just fine for me, and was easy to put back in the package for storage.<br /><br />Q. Are the Cartridges bad?<br /><br /> This was the BIGGEST complaint I read about. I am sure it is a cartridge to cartridge issue, but my original one lasted me through 2.75 uses. I had to put a new one in to finish up my leg on my last use, but I am pretty sure I got 1500 flashes or so out of it. I do recommend keeping a spare one though, because (like any technology) you might get a bad one here or there. I had no issues with it though =/<br /><br />Q. Does it hurt?<br /><br /> Heh. Depends. I use to pluck facial hair, and it hurt meplenty good, and even on a 3, this system was still kind of rough. But that is ME. My skin is sensitive, especially on my face and neck, so I expected this. Just keep a realistic outlook when you use it, and if it hurts, lower the level.<br /> On the rest of my body, the only place it make me jump a bit was the backs of my legs, and that was at a level 5.<br /><br />Q. Does it work?<br /><br /> It worked for me, as a medium toned, dark haired woman. (This is an early review too, I finished the 3rd treatment today.)<br /> Now, my results on my face are not as drastic as elsewhere on my body, because I used a lower zap. I will continue the treatments as needed, but it will take a bit longer to see the same results as my legs, on my face.<br /> My legs, underarms, and bikini area are all pretty awesome. I get a patch here and there, but they are barely noticeable. I do not have to be as exact with shaving as I use to be, and I can definitely go longer without shaving. (I use to have to shave EVERY 24 hours, or I was looking rough. Now I can go a couple days with no problem.)<br /> These are not even my full results. It will be another month or two to get through the full hair cycle, plus other hairs coming INTO cycle will start growing as well. So I won't see a true result for at least another month. This is a process.... even professional salons will tell you the same thing. It takes time, and patience, but I am already seeing results that I am pleased with.<br /><br />Tips:<br /> 1. Shave as close as possible. Most of the pain and heat I dealt with was where I got sloppy with my shaving. The closer, the better.<br /> 2. Use cocoa butter, or lotion on the areas you zap. I didn't experience irritation or dryness, but I was pretty quick to lotion up. It just makes sense to me to lotion after IPLing.<br /> 3. Set aside time to do this. It would take me around an hour to do all the parts I wanted to hit-- which isn't much time, but I needed to sit down and kind of yoga through some parts. It helped to know that I could sit on the floor, take my time, and make sure I got all the areas I wanted without interruption.<br /> 4. Be patient. I know it is frustrating, and I know how badly people want results (especially in the face area) but if you over-do it, you can harm yourself. Just give the system a chance to work the way it is supposed to.<br /><br />That is all I have for now. I hope this review helps. Again, leave questions if you'd like. I will do my best to answer them.plenty good, and even on a 3, this system was still kind of rough. But that is ME. My skin is sensitive, especially on my face and neck, so I expected this. Just keep a realistic outlook when you use it, and if it hurts, lower the level.<br /> On the rest of my body, the only place it make me jump a bit was the backs of my legs, and that was at a level 5.<br /><br />Q. Does it work?<br /><br /> It worked for me, as a medium toned, dark haired woman. (This is an early review too, I finished the 3rd treatment today.)<br /> Now, my results on my face are not as drastic as elsewhere on my body, because I used a lower zap. I will continue the treatments as needed, but it will take a bit longer to see the same results as my legs, on my face.<br /> My legs, underarms, and bikini area are all pretty awesome. I get a patch here and there, but they are barely noticeable. I do not have to be as exact with shaving as I use to be, and I can definitely go longer without shaving. (I use to have to shave EVERY 24 hours, or I was looking rough. Now I can go a couple days with no problem.)<br /> These are not even my full results. It will be another month or two to get through the full hair cycle, plus other hairs coming INTO cycle will start growing as well. So I won't see a true result for at least another month. This is a process.... even professional salons will tell you the same thing. It takes time, and patience, but I am already seeing results that I am pleased with.<br /><br />Tips:<br /> 1. Shave as close as possible. Most of the pain and heat I dealt with was where I got sloppy with my shaving. The closer, the better.<br /> 2. Use cocoa butter, or lotion on the areas you zap. I didn't experience irritation or dryness, but I was pretty quick to lotion up. It just makes sense to me to lotion after IPLing.<br /> 3. Set aside time to do this. It would take me around an hour to do all the parts I wanted to hit-- which isn't much time, but I needed to sit down and kind ofyoga through some parts. It helped to know that I could sit on the floor, take my time, and make sure I got all the areas I wanted without interruption.<br /> 4. Be patient. I know it is frustrating, and I know how badly people want results (especially in the face area) but if you over-do it, you can harm yourself. Just give the system a chance to work the way it is supposed to.<br /><br />That is all I have for now. I hope this review helps. Again, leave questions if you'd like. I will do my best to answer them.

  133. In short--best beauty product purchase of the year, and perhaps ever! I am a fair-skinned brunette, so I have exactly the right coloring for this device. I do not hesitate to highly recommend this product if you have similar coloring. My bikini area and underarms are dramatically improved. Pay attention to the color of the hair you want to remove, though. I've found the hair on my legs to be a little too light for this to have dramatic results. If you have freckles--no worries! I have freckles and have noticed no adverse response. All-in-all, you will be pleased. It costs less than one laser treatment, is much less painful than waxing and best of all, you can preserve your dignity and privacy by doing it yourself--again, and again, and again--as needed. I'm still on my first bulb, so not everyone has issues with that. Regardless, it is very inexpensive over the long term when compared to spa services.<br /><br /> Below are some details of my early experience with the product.<br /><br />******<br /><br />I've only just completed my first treatment, which went flawlessly. I was surprised and pleased that there was less discomfort than anticipated. It was quite a bit less painful than epilation. I turned it up to the highest setting by the third pulse (pulsed once on the first setting, once on the third setting and then proceeded with the 5th level from there on). It is definitely best to shave as thoroughly as possible. The treatment was most uncomfortable where the most hair was visible.<br /><br />I will update this review as I have the opportunity to observe results. So far, my impression is entirely favorable. The unit seems to be high quality and not a torture device, as I feared!<br /><br />Update, 1/20/2012. Like another reviewer, I decided to use this at closer intervals than directed. Second treatment was even easier than the first. I'm not sure whether that was due to increased attention to my shaving efforts prior to treatment or if I can expect each successive treatment to be less uncomfortable due to hair reduction. Regardless, it was a breeze! Much, much, much easier than the epilator (ouch!) that I use on peach fuzz. It is also very quick--no downtime between pulses. The only challenging part can be around bony areas where it can be difficult to get both sensors pressed simultaneously to enable a pulse. Even that is no big deal--it's usually just a matter of adjusting positioning of the handpiece horizontally or vertically to get the treatment window and sensors flush to the skin. Still no obvious results, but I didn't expect any yet. Will continue to update as I use the device and note results.<br /><br />Update, 1/26/2012. Again, I chose to treat at a shorter time interval than instructed (only 6 days this time). Honestly, it seems like I could use this daily without problem. There are zero after effects for me--not even redness. This third treatment was also virtually painless. Just a few hot, prickly sensations where there was more hair. I have also been zapping one spot on my chin where a single rogue hair tends to pop up. I'm careful to shield my eyes and it seems totally fine. The treatments are really quick. I was reading about a competing system that isn't available in the US as far as I can tell, and the unit needs to recharge between pulses which results in a prolonged treatment session. Not the case with the iLight! You can zap as quickly as you want. It literally takes less than a minute to do my underarms and less than 2 for the bikini zone. My leg takes longer since it's significantly larger. Still no big deal, though.<br /><br />So far, I am really noticing results on my under arms and bikini. This morning my under arms had no noticeable hair. Bikini is more sparse and finer. I can't say I've noticed a huge difference on my legs, but I will stick with it. Even if I end up with less and finer growth, I'll consider it a partial win since I'll be less prickly.<br /><br />One thought for anyone who is afraid of even the minimal amount of discomfort. Perhaps a numbing cream might help? I have done three treatments since my last post and I can definitely see results everywhere that I have used it.<br /><br />For my armpits, I can tell that the hair on my left armpit is more than 75% gone compared to my right armpit. I use the max setting.<br /><br />For my legs, my right leg has about 50% less hair than my left. Very painful down there so I only use the first setting and don't do anything except the bikini line.<br /><br />Very pleased with the results. Not sure why the original cartridge failed on me but am very satisfied with the customer service when I called in.<br /><br />For my next treatment, I probably won't shave before hand so that I know exactly what area needs to be zapped.<br /><br />Not giving it 5 stars due to having trouble knowing which areas need to be zapped and the first cartridge experience.<br /><br />UPDATE 3/9/12:<br /><br />I just went to use the item on my leg and it flashed twice then stopped. The cartridge indicator is still green. The item beeps like it's ready to flash then I hear a click inside the unit but it never flashes. Died during the second use.... sad.<br /><br />Original post:<br /><br /> I just purchased this item last week. I did my first treatment on my right leg this morning. The feeling of the item is nice and comfortable to use. I'm not sure how well I am at moving it slowly enough to ensure that I am covering my entire leg though. I started off using the lowest intensity setting. Next treatment, I will try to go with a higher setting.<br /><br /> Will update in two weeks with a comparison of my legs....
  139. This is a great product! I am a very frugal person who needs to make the most for every dollar spent. I've had professional laser hair removal (as a gift)in the past that cost twice as much as this product. This product works just as well as the professional treatments I've had. I am extremely pleased with the results after only four treatments. I have seen almost complete reduction in some areas (my underarms). My legs are a little more stubborn (possibly because my skin is darker from sun exposure) and they haven't showed much reduction yet, but the growth has slowed down quite a bit. I used to have to shave them each day and now it is every third day or so. I am fairly certain that with more treatments I will get the same results as my underarms. Worth every cent!

I have now had the product for about two years (and still on that same bulb!) and absolutely love it! I am in my mid twenty's, female, dark brown hair and super pale skin (think Snow White... or a ghost). My major insecurities came from a nice dark happy trail I believe i inherited from my dad (ugh). I was so self-concious when I was a teenager and in college when I wanted to wear a swimsuit. If I shaved the area, you could still tell there was hair there because my pale skin would show the hair underneath. Plus, I would get major shaving irritation. If I waxed, it would go away for a while but then grow back at different rates and gave me terrible ingrowns. In short I felt awful. I bought this strictly to get rid of the happy trail, and I have never been happier. I can finally walk around in a bathing suit and show my stomach without wanting to cover myself up with my arms or a shirt. I have also started experimenting with my armpits, and boy does that thing HURT (I use it on full setting), but it works! It takes a little longer to see results (maybe 2 weeks using it 2-3/week), but when I did, I was completely hair free!!!! I am hair-free for about a month before it starts coming back (at which point is the time to start taking it back out again so it doesn't take as long to get rid of it again). Definitely worth the money!!!!!!!!!<br />_________________________________________________<br />Old review:<br />I got this product today and was so excited to use it I immediately ripped open the package right when I got home. Hopefully my replacement cartridge works more than 10 times, otherwise amazon is getting this product back.

  147. First off let me start by saying that those of you who are using this more often than every 2 weeks are wasting your bulbs. That being said, I must say that this is working. I have medium skin tone (freckles, but tan easily) and dark hair. I am now on my 4th treatment and nearly hair free. Just when I thought I was at a stand still and the treatments were no longer working, more hairs just seem to fall out overnight. This was very close to the two week mark between treatments. That's why I say you are just wasting the bulb if you use it more often, as it did take 2 weeks to notice less hair. My bikini area definitely saw the fastest results. Maybe because of the coarser hair. I am down to shaving my legs and underarms once a week. The hair that I have left is very fine. Hopefully the treatment I did today will yield even more results! Oh, I have been using it on the highest setting, with only minimal discomfort under my arms. But I just grit my teeth and know it's worth it. It only lasts a split second. :) The only reason I don't give it 5 stars, is the price of the bulbs and the fact I have needed more treatments than I thought I would. Overall, I am very happy.

  151. Well to start off the review, you can not use this on your face.. This what I had actually ordered it for till I realized too late. It's very handy and it does seem to actually work. (tried it on face anyways with success/NOT RECOMMENDED)It's very loud when you have it running, this is due to the fact that it gets very hot. Not really a bad thing, just annoying after a while. Before you can even use it you have to put your target area (legs/arm, whatever) on the sensor and if it's ok then it'll turn green and your good to go. If it deems it unsafe or unable it will beep and stay locked while continuing to beep excessively. Zap a spot and wait 24 hours before you do anything, just in case you have a reaction or burn that shows up. Afterwards go at it, this thing does hurt. It's akin to getting flicked with a rubber band while simultaneously seeing light close to the surface of the sun around the device. Keep it flush with your skin to0 minimize this, it also wont zap till its close and has a good seal around area. Don't shock any one spot more than recomended otherwise you will pay for it later, trust me. Otherwise I'm still on my first cartridge, I've used it on my underarms and (face/NOT RECOMMENDED) with good results. I really like the thing just wish it was actually safe to use on/around the face, tons of warnings against this on the manual. Havnt used it on my legs yet, I'll try that next. You can't use this on or around your groin or by your nipples either. So this device is limited in application, keep this in mind before you buy. Otherwise enjoy.

  162. I had read the reviews before purchasing the iLight. So, I was aware of some of the issues with this unit before purchase. That said, there is one issue that I'd like to address first.<br /><br />Bulb longevity<br /><br />The bulb appears to be a type of bright (and hot) halogen bulb. As a result, it needs to be cooled. Both the base of the unit and the flash gun have fans that operate continuously while the unit is in operation. However, the one thing I have noticed is that even while the fans operate, the flash gun gets relatively hot after a large number of successive flashes. The instructions recommend using a grid motion down the surface of the skin leaving the unit touching the skin while pressing and holding the flash button and then moving to the next grid position. While holding the button down to activate the flash, the unit will continually flash every few seconds while the contact sensors make contact with the surface of the skin. After a large number of flashes, this leads the flash gun getting quite hot. I believe this is one of two problems with the unit. Basically, the fans in the flash gun are inadequate to cool the bulb between each flash. As the bulb remains too hot, it seems to reduce the lifespan of the bulb. The alternative is to wait longer between flashes or flash a number of times and let the flash gun cool down before starting the next grid area.<br /><br />The second problem is turning the unit off. Once done with your session for the day, it's tempting just to flip the switch to the off position. Don't do this. Let the unit sit and cool down until the unit begins beeping again. Then, turn it off. Letting the unit adequately cool between each session and before power off seems to increase bulb longevity.<br /><br />Whether we can actually get the Remington stated 1500 flashes out of the lamp is another matter, but I believe you'll get more than a few hundred flashes by letting the unit adequately cool down both between grid treatments and before turning it completely off.<br /><br />Efficacy<br /><br />While I would love to say that this unit is perfect, it isn't. If you have course dark hair and light enough skin to activate the unit, then you may see great results. If you have blonde, red, grey, white or thin dark or medium hair, your mileage may vary. That means, you may not see the results you expect. IPL does work for the proper skin type, hair color and thickness, it's just that this is a home unit and you shouldn't expect miracles. It also takes several treatments to see results, so don't expect to see anything after one treatment.<br /><br />The one thing I will say for this unit is that it seems to slow hair growth in the treated areas for my skin. I don't see the hairs falling out as promised, but I am still hopeful that with enough treatments that may still happen. I also haven't seen any negative effects on my skin as a result of using the unit (no burns or discoloration). Each flash, though, feels hot for just a moment and then subsides.<br /><br />Keep in mind that this is a home unit. The [[ASIN:B005CHHO4Q Remington I-Light Pro Replacement Cartridges]] are around $20-25 each which is likely cheaper than an IPL session from a local business (and definitely cheaper than laser sessions) especially considering you can usually get at least 2.5 sessions out of one lamp cartridge. The cartridges are also easy to replace.<br /><br />Strength of flash<br /><br />The iLight allows you to adjust the strength of each flash from 1 star (default) to 5 stars. If you have course dark hair and light skin, 1 star is probably enough. If you have lighter hair (or deeper roots), you may need to increase the strength up to 5 stars. As a result of increasing the strength of the flash, this likely reduces the number of flashes as well. So, I'm thinking that the possible 1500 flashes is from a unit that is properly cooled and is using 1 star for its entire lifetime. Increasing the strength and not cooling the unit properly seems to drastically reduce bulb lifetime. If you want to increase the bulb life, you will need to allow the unit to cool and use the least amount of flash strength needed to get the desired result. So, you should probably start your treatments with 1 star strength and see how that goes for several sessions before increasing the strength.<br /><br />Moisturizing prior to your session<br /><br />If you moisturize your skin prior to your sessions, this may help the unit work better. The unit needs to get the light to the root of each follicle to stop its growth. Dry skin can prevent the light from penetrating. Moisturized skin allows the light to penetrate better. However, don't moisturize immediately before the start of a session. Instead, moisturize and then wait until the lotion has dissipated and the skin is dry to the touch before starting any sessions. You don't want your skin to be wet with a moisturizer when beginning a session for several reasons. First, it may cause skin reactions. Second, the lotion will smear up the lens in the flash gun (which needs to be cleaned periodically anyway) and the unclean lens will prevent the flash from working effectively.<br /><br />The Smell<br /><br />One additional point, while doing each session, expect the smell of burning hair. This unit creates a very hot short flash which creates this burning smell with each flash. So, if you don't like this smell or don't want to smell up your room, you might want to do your sessions outside or in a well ventilated environment.<br /><br />Rating<br /><br />I'm rating this unit 3 stars for a the following reasons. First, the touted 1500 flashes from one cartridge isn't realistic. You can only get this number under perfect laboratory conditions. The best I've been able to achieve is about 300-400 at most letting the unit cool between sessions. Remington needs to be more realistic with the longevity of the cartridges. Second, the unit inadequately cools the flash lamp leading to early lamp failure based on Remington's suggested usage. Remington has a great idea, but it's executed in a mediocre way. If it had been more thoughtfully designed, I would give this unit more stars. That said, it is a home unit, so you can't expect perfection.<br /><br />I'm not saying this unit doesn't work or isn't effective. It does work. But, its effectiveness is limited by the type and thickness of the hair. Note that there is another technique which can be used with the iLight (IPL) that may make it twice as effective even on blond, red or white hair follicles. I am going to try this technique and report back. If this technique works, I will raise the star rating on this unit and include this technique.<br /><br />Updated: 5/3/2012<br /><br />I have another problem that just surfaced today. The cord connecting the flash gun to the base now has a broken cable inside it. When the thick cable is moved into a certain position, the flash gun loses power. The gun must now be moved into specific positions for the wire to make contact. Once a broken cable happens, it's will only get worse. This is clearly a warranty problem at this point, but it also shows that this unit is definitely not that well made. I have only used the iLight 8-10 times since I've gotten it and I'm not rough with it at all. There is no reason that cable should be this fragile. What I would suggest to Remington is to use a cable that is removable on both ends (from the handle and from the base). If the cable dies, you don't have to replace the whole unit. On this unit, the cable that wires the flash gun is permanently anchored to both the gun and the base. So, there's no way to replace the gun or the cable.trength and not cooling the unit properly seems to drastically reduce bulb lifetime. If you want to increase the bulb life, you will need to allow the unit to cool and use the least amount of flash strength needed to get the desired result. So, you should probably start your treatments with 1 star strength and see how that goes for several sessions before increasing the strength.<br /><br />Moisturizing prior to your session<br /><br />If you moisturize your skin prior to your sessions, this may help the unit work better. The unit needs to get the light to the root of each follicle to stop its growth. Dry skin can prevent the light from penetrating. Moisturized skin allows the light to penetrate better. However, don't moisturize immediately before the start of a session. Instead, moisturize and then wait until the lotion has dissipated and the skin is dry to the touch before starting any sessions. You don't want your skin to be wet with a moisturizer when beginning a session for several reasons. First, it may cause skin reactions. Second, the lotion will smear up the lens in the flash gun (which needs to be cleaned periodically anyway) and the unclean lens will prevent the flash from working effectively.<br /><br />The Smell<br /><br />One additional point, while doing each session, expect the smell of burning hair. This unit creates a very hot short flash which creates this burning smell with each flash. So, if you don't like this smell or don't want to smell up your room, you might want to do your sessions outside or in a well ventilated environment.<br /><br />Rating<br /><br />I'm rating this unit 3 stars for a the following reasons. First, the touted 1500 flashes from one cartridge isn't realistic. You can only get this number under perfect laboratory conditions. The best I've been able to achieve is about 300-400 at most letting the unit cool between sessions. Remington needs to be more realistic with the longevity of the cartridges. Second, the unit inadequately cools the flash lamp leading to early lamp failure based on Remington's suggested usage. Remington has a great idea, but it's executed in a mediocre way. If it had been more thoughtfully designed, I would give this unit more stars. That said, it is a home unit, so you can't expect perfection.<br /><br />I'm not saying this unit doesn't work or isn't effective. It does work. But, its effectiveness is limited by the type and thickness of the hair. Note that there is another technique which can be used with the iLight (IPL) that may make it twice as effective even on blond, red or white hair follicles. I am going to try this technique and report back. If this technique works, I will raise the star rating on this unit and include this technique.<br /><br />Updated: 5/3/2012<br /><br />I have another problem that just surfaced today. The cord connecting the flash gun to the base now has a broken cable inside it. When the thick cable is moved into a certain position, the flash gun loses power. The gun must now be moved into specific positions for the wire to make contact. Once a broken cable happens, it's will only get worse. This is clearly a warranty problem at this point, but it also shows that this unit is definitely not that well made. I have only used the iLight 8-10 times since I've gotten it and I'm not rough with it at all. There is no reason that cable should be this fragile. What I would suggest to Remington is to use a cable that is removable on both ends (from the handle and from the base). If the cable dies, you don't have to replace the whole unit. On this unit, the cable that wires the flash gun is permanently anchored to both the gun and the base. So, there's no way to replace the gun or the cable.

There seems to be a bit less hair in the treated areas but not enough to recommend the light pro.
  171. It doesn't seem to be doing quite as well on my underarms, but they were pretty sparse to begin with and it only takes a minute to keep trying with those. It's actually doing a great job of maintaining my bikini line, which I had zapped professionally about a year ago. It's worth it for that alone. I'm pretty fair, with light brown hair, but my leg hair it quite dark so I know I'm a good candidate, but I can honestly say it is working for me.

  175. I had my legs, underarms and upper-lip professionally lasered 4 years ago, so I know how painful salon lasering is. It took 18 treatments (every 6 weeks) over a 2 year period at a cost of around $4000, which was also painful, but it was worth every penny and all of the excrutiating pain (I am not kidding - every pulse felt like someone had pulled back a large rubber band as far as it could go and then let it snap). I wore yoga pants for two days after each session because my skin was tender and swollen and felt like it was badly sunburnt, but the results were absolutely worth it! About a year ago I started epilating my hairy arms and wishing that I had had them done at the same time as my legs, and now that the Brazilian wax is the thing to do, I wish I had had my whole bikini area done, although I don't know if I could tolerate that pain, honestly. I also have to pull anywhere from 20 to 70 hairs a DAY from my chin, and it has gotten so bad that I decided to give the Light Pro a shot. It is less than the cost of one session, so I figured that it was worth the risk of it not working. Let me say that I am fair-skinned and very dark-haired, so I am the ideal candidate for laser. I wouldn't necessarily presume that this works as well for lighter-haired people. My hair grows extraordinarily fast - I was epilating my arms every 5 days and I have already stated that my little black chin-whiskers were popping up daily. This does say not to use on the face, but I figured that if the salon could do it then so could I so I disregarded the warning, and it has been fine except for a few bumps the next day that go away in a few days. I got the Light Pro about 3 weeks ago and used it immediately. I used the highest setting (which I would recommend, as you get 1000 flashes per bulb regardless of the intensity that you use, so you might as well be as effective as possible)and overlapped even though it says not to. The pain is only a fraction of the salon laser, so I was pretty skeptical as to its effectiveness, but I still kept at it. Rather than wait two weeks as the instructions tell you, I waited two days and did it again, and then I epilated, since my hairs were so long at that point that I had to wear long sleeves. I waited about a week and then treated all areas again, although I did not see any improvement at this point and fully expected that before the month was up I would be packing it up and trying to get Amazon to refund my $250. A week and a day later I started on my 3rd treatment. I finished my chin and arms and was a few pulses into my bikini area when the thing started beeping and stopped delivering pulses. I re-read the manual and realized that my cartridge was used up, which kind of pissed me off because it claimed to have enough flashes to cover the entire body for 3 sessions, and I had only gotten 2 and a half of just my chin, arms, and bikini area, but I did overlap to cover every centimeter of the skin I was treating, so... I discovered that another cartridge would cost $25, and decided not to waste any more $ on this project when it occurred to me that my bikini area is now very patchy. It is definitely at least 30% less dense. It also occurred to me that I hadn't pulled more than 10 or 15 hairs from my chin in a single day in the past week. Hmmm...maybe I should hold off on the refund thing. I epilated my arms that night (Wed), and it is now Sunday night and my hair growth is barely noticible, and what has grown back is very fine and thin. So I ordered another cartridge this morning, because at this rate I believe that I will have hair-free arms and a hair free bikini area by summer, although it may take two more cartridges. Still, the machine plus 2 cartridges is still about $85 less than a single session at the salon, so it is WELL worth the cost! To sum it up, don't be discouraged because you don't see immediate results. Give it two treatments and I thing you will notice significant changes in your hair growthand density, but do expect that it will cost you a few $25 cartridges along with the initial cost of the machine, especially if you are doing your legs.
  176. ***Update #1 (04/23/2012)********************<br /><br />I have used my i-light pro to treat my legs, bikini area and underarms 3 times. Despite the advice on the box, I have used it to treat my chin 5 to 6 times. I am very happy with the results. I am not seeing 100% results but I did not expect them. I would say that I have approx 50% less hair growth on my legs and 75% less hair under my arms. As for my chin, I believe that the hair in this area is very resistant (I have had it treated professionally several times also). I definitely see hair loss on my chin but I would like it to be more. The hairs that do grow back seem to be more fine and grow at a slower rate. I work in an operating room and the temperature is very cold. I shave my legs every day but once I get to work I get goosebumps from the cold and it immediately feels like I need to shave again. I have not noticed this feeling as much since I have been using the i-light pro. Sounds silly but that is important to me.<br /><br />I have been using the machine at the highest pulse level with minimal discomfort. I do notice that I am more sensitive (more uncomfortable) approx 1 week before my menstrual cycle. I learned that this is true from the nurse who performed the professional treatments on me in the office.<br /><br />As I mentioned I have used the product multiple times. I have NOT had to replace the cartridge yet. I anticipate that I will need to change it very soon. I have not had any problems with using the product.<br /><br />My only complaint is the storage of the unit. The cords are very long (which I like) but there is no easy way to coil them up and store it in the box it originally came in. Not that big of a deal.<br /><br />***Original review (01/30/2012)********************<br /><br />I received a mailing from my local Ulta store which advertised this product. I went online to research this product and noticed that it was relatively new....so I was hesitant to purchase it without anything to base my opinion on and because of the price. I have had professional laser treatments many times in the past for my underarms, bikini area and chin. I have had amazing results with those treatments but as many of you are aware...the expense of professional treatments is not cheap. I have desperately been wanting to treat my legs for years. I bought the Remington i-Light Pro 2 weeks ago (Ulta had a 20% off coupon...so I was able to purchase this product for $200 instead of $250).<br /><br />The product is easy to use and has easy to understand instructions. The product was carefully designed to keep safety as the #1 priority. I did not experience any problems with the machine as other users have described. Professional laser treatments can be very uncomfortable depending on the location and sensitivity of the area being treated. After using the i-Light Pro, it would be safe to say that the level of discomfort is nowhere near as significant as professional treatments. I used the highest setting for my treatments. This is probably because professional machines have higher levels of laser penetration...therefore, higher level of results. Products for home use will never deliver professional results or intensity.<br /><br />It has been 1 1/2 weeks since my first treatment. I treated both of my legs (whole leg) and bikini area. I did not have to replace the cartridge. I have to admit that I have noticed results. I have taken tweezers and noticed that I have hairs that are coming out without the need to \\"tug\\" on the hair as you normally would using tweezers...it basically just falls out without any discomfort.<br /><br />I look forward to using the i-Light Pro in the future and hope that it will reduce my hair growth significantly. One thing to keep in mind when purchasing products like this or having professional treatments....HAIR WILL ALWAYS GROW BACK no matter what you are promised. My professional treatments had amazing results, it has been approx 6 years since I had my underarms treated. When my treatments were complete, I probably had 5 to 6 hairs that continued to grow (which I just plucked instead of shaving)...since then I now have probably 50 to 60 hairs that grow. The hairs that were treated did not come back, new hairs have appeared. This is due to hormonal changes...amongst many other reasons (ie. medications).<br /><br />Considering I have only completed one treatment, I am very happy with my results. The price of the machine itself is less than one professional treatment. It is worth a shot. Even if this machine only provides me with 50% reduction of hair growth, I would say it was worth the money.<br /><br />I will post updates to my review periodically to keep you posted.
  177. I have had mine for about two months and due to being very busy, I have only been able to use it twice, since this will take you an hour to use on the legs alone, I have not had time. The first use, I didn't know what I was doing. I shaved right before using it, which I think is a mistake. The second time, I shaved the night before I used it and got FABULOUS results within a couple of weeks. It stings a lot more when you let a day pass between shaving and lasering, but since the hair is starting to grow back within 24 hours of shaving, this guarantees you catch your hair in the all-important \\"growing\\" phase. I have only used my device on level 4, which gives you a little sting, but is a tolerable level for most people with very light skin.<br /><br />I'm proud to say that I have patches on my calves with absolutely no hair growing at all and spots where the hair is extremely fine and light in color now. I wonder how long these results will actually last? Could some of it be permanent? I hope so. As a precaution, I purchased some laser protection glasses from Amazon prior to using this. I understand the materials that come with it do not mention laser protection glasses, but if they don't want you using this on your face, it's likely that is because of the laser around the fan would shine in your eyes and destroy your vision. If you've ever been to a medical spa, they always put laser protection glasses on you no matter where they are lasering, so I suggest you protect your vision and get you some glasses, to be sure. Hair removal would not be worth endangering your vision.<br /><br />I look forward to many more treatments and the continual reduction in hair. I can already tell my razors are lasting longer since they have a lot less stubble to shave. The only difficulty I will have is trying to figure out where to zap. They tell you NOT to draw a grid pattern on your legs, so it's very hard to tell where you need to zap and where you don't. I guess I just have to keep zapping around until I get it all.<br /><br />***UPDATE: May 28, 2012***<br />I stopped using this for a couple of months to see what would happen and guess what? All of the hair came back. I know the box says, \\"temporary\\" results, but I thought at least some of it would not come back. I still highly recommend the product and plan to resume my usage of it, but just know that this is something you will have to maintain and it definitely DOES NOT produce permanent hair removal. The results are exactly what they say, 'temporary', but long enough to make it worth doing, if you don't mind the expense and don't want to go the route of permanent removal.p zapping around until I get it all.<br /><br />***UPDATE: May 28, 2012***<br />I stopped using this for a couple of months to see what would happen and guess what? All of the hair came back. I know the box says, \\"temporary\\" results, but I thought at least some of it would not come back. I still highly recommend the product and plan to resume my usage of it, but just know that this is something you will have to maintain and it definitely DOES NOT produce permanent hair removal. The results are exactly what they say, 'temporary', but long enough to make it worth doing, if you don't mind the expense and don't want to go the route of permanent removal.

Also, the bulbs die prematurely. I should know... I've gone through 7 bulbs in the for 2 months.<br /><br />Most of the reviews here are 5-star reviews by people who 1) never bought the item 2) have used it once or twice. If you look carefully at the reviews, almost all of the 4 to 5-star reviews are from people who have NEVER written an Amazon review in their life. I fall into that category, but I am so fed up by the # of false reviews for this product that I feel I have to speak up.<br /><br />Just my 2 cents. I counted the number of \\"flashes\\" I got each time I used it. The total was 973 before the light saying I needed a new bulb came on. They advertise 1000-1500, so this was pretty close. But... this still only covered 2 treatments of my underarms, lower legs, and biking line. I'm ordering a new bulb right now.<br /><br />In terms of effectiveness, I used the product on my underarms, legs, and bikini line for hair removal (as stated above). I have yet to see results in terms of reduction in hair growth, but will update in two weeks again. I used the i-light on my face to see if it would \\"spot treat\\" my remaining malasma/freckles. You're not *supposed* to use it on your face, but I decided to give it a go anyway. I will update if I see results. Also, I have had laser treatment for spider veins. I have been triple zapping my remaining spider veins with the i-light and, again, will update if I see results.<br /><br />So... to sum up:<br /><br />*PROS:<br />Bulb life seems to be as advertised<br />No pain with use<br />Gentle on the face (though you are not supposed to use it there)<br /><br />*CONS:<br />I have yet to see any reduction in hair growth (after 2 weeks)...   185. I'm refraining from a 5 star review for 2 simple reasons: only when my treatments have been completed and I can assess the long-term results will I be able to definitely give it an extra star or not. And secondly, as other reviews have noted, the IPL cartridge that comes with the I-Light Pro appears to be defective for a significant number of buyers, including me. Mine just died today well well short of the 1500 zaps promised, I intend to contact Remington about this.<br /><br />Putting that aside, on to the review. I can't remember the last time I have been compelled to write a review so early, and so enthusiastically! When it comes to hair removal products, feeling enthusiastic about any one of the thousands out there is very rare indeed. As someone who bought the Tria a year ago for the ridiculous price of $495 with very high hopes and expectations, my experience with that product was abhorrent. I gave it a 1 star review due to its terrible flaws and for the simple fact that it did not work for me AT ALL. If I could give it a 0 I would. After the endless hours invested and multiple treatments I had nothing to show for it.<br /><br />I had several salon IPL sessions done on my chest and stomach in 2005 which cost me something like $1200. I decided to stop the treatments due to this high cost and because at that point I was satisfied enough with the results I got which were impressive: at least a 60-65% reduction in hair which throughout the years since has remained permanent. So I begin my treatments with the experience of having had IPL treatments done in the past and with less than half the hair I had naturally. I completed my first session the day after I received the I-light Pro, and I used the highest setting from the start (which I recommend, unless your pain tolerance is very low). The pain was quite reminiscent of the salon treatments I had, which I took as a good sign--if you feel nothing when you zap that means you either have no hair in the area or thehair is too fine for the follicle to absorb the light and be killed. Over time, as you lose hair (too soon to make any conclusions about long term permanence) treatments will be far less painful as there is less hair to zap.<br /><br />Nevertheless having the Tria experience in mind I didn't let myself get too happy since those treatments were also painful but in the end nothing happened. Immediately and in the days after the treatment nothing looked different, the hair began to grow like after any shave--this is normal. It was on or about the ten-day mark that something remarkable happened: after taking off a t-shirt I noticed on the inside tons of little hairs! This was exactly what happened to the hair after the salon treatments at $250 a pop. The dead hair gets ejected from your skin. It's working! At the 2 week mark, I can see new bald spots where those little hairs have fallen out. I can confidently say that after a single treatment close to 20% of the hair on my chest and stomach has disappeared and another large percentage of hairs have thinned out (or perhaps the new spareness giving that illusion.) I am simply in awe of this product. The price, the ergonomics (mostly), the larger zap area, the convenience and ultimately the results make this in my opinion the holy grail of at home laser hair removal.<br /><br />Unfortunately 1/4 of the way into my second treatment the IPL cartridge gave in, so I would hope Remington starts to impose some quality control on these cartridges. If you want close to hair free results, it will take more than 3 treatments--it could take up to 6 or 8 or even 10 depending on an individual's hair. But that is okay. This product works, and is far faster and efficient in covering all your areas. I never imagined back when I was doing salon treatments that one day I could buy my own machine for less the price of one session and do it myself with actual results. Amazing.<br /><br />UPDATE 2/24/2013:<br /><br />I completely forgot abouthaving written this review so I didn't get the chance to update based on further usage. So after using the product several more times, including a long months-long pause (I went on vacation and got a deep tan) and then once again doing about 2 more sessions after re-starting I'm going to have to lower my review by one star. I had higher hopes for the product but in the end it's quite clear that this is not a permanent solution. What it is though, is a very effective temporary reduction solution. In my experience I would have to say that you could do 10 sessions to the T and you will still not get *permanent* hair loss results--what it will do is put a huge amount of your hair follicles in some kind of dormant mode--and I'll gladly say that this is a decent outcome. The results can last for months and months. You will have so much less hair for such a long time that any grooming you may have to do will be significantly reduced. So in the end, this product is a disappointment in one respect (expecting salon laser-like permanent results) but on the other hand I wouldn't characterize its temporary results as a waste of time either, since the temporary nature of the results actually do last a long time--which makes shaving whatever is left a breeze until you see that you need a maintenance session to put the hair to sleep once again. It is still a much much much better value for money than the piece of garbage that is the TRIA. One word of advice that bears repeating: use it on the highest setting from the start. Using the lower settings becomes that much more of a waste considering there's no permanent loss.<br /><br />My hope is that over the next few years Remington or other companies will improve these systems by increasing the longevity of the cartridges, reduction of noise and heat, larger zap area, and most important of all increase the energy output of the light/laser in order to cause permanent hair loss.

  190. I was skeptical about this working, with the negative reviews.<br />I purchased one of these refurb from another site, but know I depend on Amazon reviews, so told myself no matter what, I would write a review.<br /><br />A bit of background:<br />I am Asian-American with olive toned skin. Light, but not white. I tan very dark in the summer.<br />My hair is dark-brown almost black.<br /><br />I grow very little hair anywhere except on top of my head/ on my face where you would expect, on my underarms, and in the bikini area where you would expect.<br />Problem, I also grow a very coarse patch on my chin, thinner on my neck, and a few coarse bits on my upper lip.<br />That hair irritates my skin, and I break out near/ in it.<br />Shaving also irritates it/ makes ingrown hairs.<br /><br />Experiment:<br />I decided, if it works, I was willing to let it take the extra time, and since my chin grows the same amount on each side, neck too, that I would only use it on one side and shave/ pluck like I normally do on the other side. Areas: Chin, neck, upper lip, underarms.<br />Following the instructions to clean, shave, etc the areas to be zapped.<br /><br />Day 1:<br />Could only zap my chin on 1-2, was a bit freaked at the snapping and flashing.<br />Underarm: not even a tickle, even on the highest setting.<br />Smelled a mild scent of burning hair, which happened each time I used it.<br /><br />Week 1-2:<br />I did not wait the time limit, and zapped my chin every 3-4 days for 2 weeks.<br />Zapped underarms 1/week.<br />Was not sure I saw anything.<br /><br />Week 3-4:<br />By now zapping full strength on chin and neck and underarm.<br />Zapping of chin was 1-2/ week, underarms 1/ week.<br />Definite change in the chin, not as much in the underarms.<br /><br />Week 6:<br />Continue the pattern of zapping frequency<br />Chin on the zapped side is 95% no hair. I went without shaving/ doing anything for 4 days to either side.<br />The few hairs on the zapped side are from where there are contours, and probably missed due to the small zapping window.<br />Underarm: Maybe 50% less.<br /><br />Week 7-10:<br />Stepped up the underarm to every 3 days.<br />Chin is pretty well clear except for stragglers here and there.<br />Underarm showing definite difference from other side, now.<br />Breakouts are pretty much gone from my face near the zapped areas.<br /><br />Results:<br />It works.<br />None of the Cons below are deal breakers in the least. I gave it 4 stars only because per instructions, it was not working quite as I expected.<br /><br />Pros:<br />It works.<br />Can do it at home<br />Is convenient<br />is quick.<br />Long, heavy cord.<br />AC cord is generously long<br />Hand held unit is nice sized for a small hand.<br />No more shaving, stubble, etc.<br /><br />Cons:<br />The &#34;skin sensor&#34; to unlock it is supposed to be used each time, apparently on the place you want to zap. That sensor is on top of the base unit.<br />If you are using it on curvy skin- like an underarm or chin, the &#34;touch sensor&#34; can be a bit tricky to align. Instruction manual has some hints that worked.<br />The frequency recommended looks like it should be upped a bit.<br />The price was scary for something I was not sure would work.<br />The zapping window is small, and sometimes hard to align- hence the stragglers on my chin. The whole head is not the zapper, but a small window on the head. Not that bit of an issue: just go over those the next time. Eventually they will go away.<br /><br />Things I have not tested:<br />I used it only on a small area, less than 25 zaps per session. I have no way to advise on the longevity of the bulb.<br />Long term, I do not know if the hair will regrow. It's now been 4 months and seems ok, though. If the hairs grow back, I would still use it again.here there are contours, and probably missed due to the small zapping window.<br />Underarm: Maybe 50% less.<br /><br />Week 7-10:<br />Stepped up the underarm to every 3 days.<br />Chin is pretty well clear except for stragglers here and there.<br />Underarm showing definite difference from other side, now.<br />Breakouts are pretty much gone from my face near the zapped areas.<br /><br />Results:<br />It works.<br />None of the Cons below are deal breakers in the least. I gave it 4 stars only because per instructions, it was not working quite as I expected.<br /><br />Pros:<br />It works.<br />Can do it at home<br />Is convenient<br />is quick.<br />Long, heavy cord.<br />AC cord is generously long<br />Hand held unit is nice sized for a small hand.<br />No more shaving, stubble, etc.<br /><br />Cons:<br />The &#34;skin sensor&#34; to unlock it is supposed to be used each time, apparently on the place you want to zap. That sensor is on top of the base unit.<br />If you are using it on curvy skin- like an underarm or chin, the &#34;touch sensor&#34; can be a bit tricky to align. Instruction manual has some hints that worked.<br />The frequency recommended looks like it should be upped a bit.<br />The price was scary for something I was not sure would work.<br />The zapping window is small, and sometimes hard to align- hence the stragglers on my chin. The whole head is not the zapper, but a small window on the head. Not that bit of an issue: just go over those the next time. Eventually they will go away.<br /><br />Things I have not tested:<br />I used it only on a small area, less than 25 zaps per session. I have no way to advise on the longevity of the bulb.<br />Long term, I do not know if the hair will regrow. It's now been 4 months and seems ok, though. If the hairs grow back, I would still use it again.
  191. Overall hair re-growth is markedly sparser after 3 treatments. Areas of treatment: legs, underarms, bikini, chin, and upper lip. Looking forward to seeing continued eradication of unwanted hair. I highly recommend the Remington I-Light Pro to anyone who struggles with unwanted hair. Do keep in mind that results are not immediately noticeable so lots of patience is required. Be sure to wait at least 1 week between treatments and brace yourself for a bit of pain. A couple of Advils 20 minutes before treatment is helpful.
  192. I'm a pretty hairy GUY and started shaving and epilating my body hair as soon as I started getting it. Since I let it all grow back, I've had years and years of persistent in-grown hair issues - and I'm tired of all the scarring. So, I started shaving and started using this product to end all this nonsense, but on a budget (yes, it's an expensive investment, but better than professional treatment).<br /><br />As I write this (5/12/12), it's been about a week since I've treated my upper legs and upper arms for the first time, and I must say that I see results. I haven't noticed any hairs falling out on my legs yet, but the hair is definitely growing a lot more slowly. I'd have a \\"five o'clock shadow\\" on my legs the day I shaved, but they were still pretty smooth the day after. Even now, the hair is much shorter than it should be if I hadn't zapped it with the IPL. The hair IS still there, though, and you can definitely see the little black spots under the skin. Hopefully those will go away completely when the hair falls out.<br /><br />My upper arms are showing a lot more improvement. The growth is also a lot slower, but some hairs have actually fallen out. Kind of patchy, even though I'm sure I got good coverage.<br /><br />I'll update if I see any significant improvement.

I can't tell you if it works effectively or not but I can tell you for the few zaps that I received it is a feeling similar to real laser hair removal but less intense. I wouldn't buy it again.

I had to use some strong exfoliating products to deal with my skin at first. However, I continued to use this regularly, and now have had such great results that I continue with only touch up treatments. I've had greatly reduced hair growth in the treated areas and I would highly recommend this to anyone with some patience.
  197. Holy cow... thank you Remington for putting out yet another stellar product! I am Irish with (very) white skin and dark auburn hair, and the Light Pro does wonders for me. I'm using it on my legs, bikini, under arm... you name it. This product is clearly well-made: various different strength settings (does anyone use anything but the highest? maybe good for the faint of heart), a long power cord, a long wand cord, and a skin tester to &#34;unlock&#34; the tool to verify you are using it on the correct skin tones. Remember when using, you need to be vigilant! The tool covers about a 1cmm area of skin at a time (similar to professional tools), so you have to move it very little when in use from one section to the next. But even still, I find I can use it very quickly. Love it, hope to be hair free by summer!
  198. I absolutely love my I-Light Pro laser! I originally bought it for facial hair, after I received it I read the directions said not to use on the face. I was disappointed but decided to try it on my face anyways. I couldn't be happier. I protect my eyes with UV glasses and my facial hair is now gone. I absolutely love this little laser!
  199. absolutely love this product but the bulb goes very fast
  200. I have had 10-12 professional laser treatments on my legs(full leg and bikini) which cost a good deal and have had pretty decent results considering what I started out with. It used to take me 15 minutes to shave my full legs and the tub would be covered with hair. Now i can shave 2-3xweek and the hair is finer. I am by no means hairless after all those professional treatments. hair growth is dependent on genetics and follicle sensitivity to testosterone/DHT in both men and women. Hormone levels will fluctuate throughout your lifetime and theses changes can reactivate hair follicles and start producing dark hair again. The only way to prevent hair regrowth after treatments is to take MEDICATIONS which block DHT like propecia or spironolactone or bith control pills. I took spiro for 6 months and did laser and had amazing results but drugs have side effects so off the drugs, hair comes back. The ONLY form of permanent hair removal to date is electrolysis and even that can take a year/years and is not good for large areas.<br /><br />My experience with the Remington is similar to professional laser treatments:the results from the highest setting on the device yield the same results as the lower settings on professional laser. About 1 in 5 hairs falls out about 2 weeks later. It takes that long for the hair to fall out. Some dark freckles on my arm burned and came off(this is also how they remove dark skin discoloration and tattoos so beware if you want to keep those cute little dark spots). I did use it on my chin and the skin blistered a bit in one area but is healed now. I expect that with more frequent use I will have decent results. The cartridge burns out quickly, especially since I go over the same area multiple times but at 20 bucks a pop, even if if I use 2/month is STILL cheaper than professional laser. The settings that worked for professional laser were incredibly painful. The same pain was felt with the remington only in my underarms where the hair is dark,thick and the skin is lighter and thinner. Good luck all.
  201. Sigh - the product does seem to work although if you have visions of smooth as silk skin and never shaving again, that's probably unrealistic.<br /><br />I was initially pleased that there seemed to be significantly less underarm hair (although some pesky hairs kept coming back)... but now I am not happy because I sweat significantly more. I wasn't sure it was from the laser treatments (it is summer, after all), but there does seem to be some data that link these together.<br /><br />Axillary hair removal with 1064-nm Nd:YAG laser increases sweat production.<br />Aydin F, Pancar GS, Senturk N, Bek Y, Yuksel EP, Canturk T, Turanli AY.<br />Clin Exp Dermatol. 2010 Aug;35(6):588-92. Epub 2009 Oct 23.<br /><br />[Novel adverse effects of laser-assisted axillary hair removal].<br />Hélou J, Soutou B, Jamous R, Tomb R.<br />CONCLUSION:<br />Hyperhidrosis, bromhidrosis and leukotrichia are likely new adverse effects of laser-assisted axillary hair removal.<br /><br />Just wanted to let people know.<br /><br />Update 8/2013:<br /><br />I upped the stars. I still think its possible that I sweat more, but it's not really that big a deal- maybe the effect was temporary, or it's small enough that I don't mind.<br /><br />In terms of hair loss, I have significantly less hair than before. The underarm hair is very fine, does not grow that long, and only seems to grow in a few fine patches. I have a theory that the remaining hairs are related to skin pigment. In terms of legs, also significantly less hair. I can get away with not shaving at all.... The skin does not feel totally smooth, but you can't see any hair.<br /><br />So overall, I think it was worth it.

I bought the actual system along with a refill cartridge, but unlike some other people have stated, the cartridge the system came with lasted for quite a long time. I followed the directions and about a week later I started noticing a difference. I've used it several times since I got it, and the amount of hair growing back on my legs is noticeably less. I will say, though, that I have a lot of difficulty using it under my arms because, even on the lowest setting, it hurts soo much.

I intend to use this on my legs; if it goes well I will use on my underarm area. I will update in a few months with my results.<br /><br />UPDATE: After three uses spaced two weeks apart as directed, I am noticing a difference. There is approximately 25-30% reduction in growth and regrowth is noticeably slower. Usually I have some stubble the day after shaving; now stubble isn't really noticeable for two or three days. I think these results will improve in time. So at this time I say this is working, albeit more slowly than advertised.
  205. I'll be updating this, and possibly changing the star rating. We'll see. First, I do have to say that I have PCOS (Poly Cystic Ovarian Syndrome). For those of you, lucky enough to NOT have this syndrome, I'll explain. I have massive amounts of black hair, EVERYWHERE. I admit, I have been cheating so far, and have been using it every other day on my lower legs, abdomen, chest, and face. Even though I know the directions say not to use it on the face, and to use it every 2 weeks. I did buy red laser goggles, so, I am protecting my eyes. I have really high hopes for this machine.<br /><br />I've never had laser treatments at a salon, I never had the money. I've been dealing with unwanted hair by shaving, and have been shaving since the ripe old age of 14. I'm now 33, so, as you can imagine, the 5'oclock shadow is prominent. And it's getting to the point where I have to buy special theatrical make-up from Ben Nye to cover the mustache (even immediately after shaving). I have really fair skin, so, This is product is supposed to be perfect.<br /><br />The first thing I noticed, is that since I'm a pro with a razor by now, I have to wait until evening to use this machine (otherwise I feel nothing, and smell no burned hair). So, I advise having stubble to use it on. When there's stubble, it does feel like a rubber band snapping you, but, it's not horrible. I have it on the highest setting for my legs, stomach, and chest. But, I do have to turn it down to #2 for my face right now. But, I started on 1, so, it gets more tolerable. I haven't noticed any difference as of yet, but, I have noticed that I'm starting to itch. I'm told that means the hair is starting to detach! Yay!! (I hope). More to come!!<br /><br />Update 12/2/13: So, I decided to get out the tweezers last night. The hair is starting to just slide right out of the follicle. So, it appears to be working!!<br /><br />Update 12/10/13: This is definitely working!! Now, if you're one of those people who have a few hairs here and there, I have no sympathy, and you're likely not going to like this machine. But, I can tell you that my chest has went from dark black hairs and having to shave it off every day, to not having to shave it at all in over 5 days. I'm talking 90% reduction in hair in that area. I haven't noticed a difference in my face or my legs, but, I can honestly say that I'm at about a 50% reduction on my stomach as well. I haven't used it on my legs in about a week though. The light died on me, but, I honestly don't blame it haha. I used it at least 4 times on my lower legs, my stomach, my chest, and my face. So, I'm sure it was at least 1500 pulses before it went out. I can say that, so far, it's cut my daily shaving ritual down considerably, and I'm sooo not done. I'm ordering another replacement battery, just because I don't want to be without it. So far, I absolutely do not regret my purchase. I moved the star rating up to a 4, because it is most definitely working. It'll get a 5 when it proves to me that it works everywhere, and gives me a good amount of hair reduction everywhere. Oh, and I have been able to up the strength to a 5 (the highest level) everywhere I use it.

  210. I'm Indian with thick curly hair that has historically been awful about getting ingrown after waxing. So I've been shaving for a good 30 years or so and was really only looking for something that would slow down the process. The iLight is awesome.<br /><br />It's not perfect: hair does eventually start growing back in near-noticeable thickness after about 6-8 months in my case. So, hey, I invested another $25 in another lightbulb and another 90 minutes of minor wincing, and I'm back to shaving once a week at MOST. My eyebrow waxing lady oohed and aahed over the results, and surely she would be a good judge :-)<br /><br />The important thing to remember is that you must do the treatment 3 times in one 2-week time period. If you don't, some hairs in the treated areas will escape being zapped during their growth cycle. I was more rigorous about doing each patch 3 separate times a few days apart on my second round of treatment (and possibly the follicles are meeker after their last experience), and I am seeing more consistent results.<br /><br />Another tip that may be useful to remember is that a lot of the people who \\"qualify\\" to use the iLight may have variable skin color over their body surface. Since darker skin absorbs more energy, I am cautious over tanned areas--in fact, I'm waiting to do my forearms till winter when they've faded a bit, because the darker the area, the more it stings.

The only bright side is apparently I didn't get a defective cartridge like a bunch of people seemed to- mine didn't give out until near the end of my last treatment.<br /><br />I was very hopeful after reading the reviews here, but apparently this machine is not for me. I'm going to pass it on to a friend and see if it works better for her.

You can figure on paying roughly $25 for ONE treatment of your two legs. Good luck hitting the underarms or bikini area before the light &#34;burns out.&#34; So by the time she used this on all the places she wanted, we're in it for almost $50/month to use this thing.<br /><br />3. Quality control. Apparently this is put together by monkeys. I am very careful in caring for anything electronic (I still have and use 20+ year old electronic equipment). After each use, it was stored back in it's original box exactly as it was shipped. But one month after the warranty expires, the wand malfunctions. New light does nothing to fix it. No diagnostics of any sort, can't unplug the wand and buy a new one. Now I have a $230 useless paperweight that has cost me closer to $400 (lights, you know!) with no lasting results to show for it.<br /><br />Save yourself the headache of dealing with this, suck it up, and pay a professional. Or, you know, just take $300-400 and flush it down the toilet. I'd flush the i-Light, if it would fit.

  243. I stalked this product on sale for about 1 year before I finally decided to buy it. I was worried that it wasn't going to work, and it's not exactly cheap. I guess I was deterred by negative reviews. However, this is a great product.<br /><br />Let's start with me. I'm half asian, so I have the really dark hair. I tan easily, but mostly my skin is light. As soon as I got this, I read the manual and watched the instruction videos. I started with my armpit. Yes, the application is a bit uncomfortable (think sewing and pricking yourself with a needle without breaking skin uncomfortable), but not really bad. At first it didn't look like anything happened. However, by the end of the 2 week waiting period, I could see I had less dense hair. It's been 4 applications, and I'm almost to no hairs growing under my arms, which is pretty awesome. I think it is taking that long because I have thicker hair, but overall this product is doing an amazing job. It is not quicker than shaving, but considering the fact that the hair doesn't grow in the next day, it is totally worth it. Much less painful than waxing, much less smelly than hair removal products, and overall just lasts longer!<br /><br />If you were not sure about this product before, I highly recommend it!

  254. i'm a guy. i like certain areas to be smooth. hey it's 2012! that's okay these days! ;-) anyway this is actually targeted to guys AND gals though of course it's mostly women that are into hair removal. but there's even a guy on the package / box for this, and if you check the remington online site and watch their promo video, they also show a guy using it!<br /><br />anyway after having this for about 5 months now, i have definitely noticed a difference in frequency and volume of hair, in areas that i want to keep smooth. there is *not* 100% reduction in hair -- but there is definitely less. i wouldn't say this has left me hairless, it has just left me with less hair, in areas i target.<br /><br />i started off using power level 1 like the instructions suggest. and waiting \\"2 weeks\\" for the hair to fall out per instructions, but i didn't really notice anything. i started turning up the volume, and now i use it on power level 5, the highest. and although it says use it every 2 weeks, i do it every week. this still has *not* zapped the hair completely (white skin, black hair... should be a perfect candidate for this to work), BUT... there is definitely less hair. and whatever else remains i just shave daily.<br /><br />it is definitely definitely more smooth. but where ever i zap is not 100% hair free. but oh well your body is trying to naturally grow hair and you're trying to kill it! i guess nature wins! still... for removing 70-80% of the hair, i think this actually does a good job. i'd give it 5 stars if it did ALL the hair, especially because of skin and hair type, where it says i'm the perfect candidate.<br /><br />as a note... i've tried shaving before... and epilating before. both these methods would ALWAYS lead to unsightly, bumpy and uncomfy ingrown hairs, even if if tried every trick in the book to avoid them (tend skin, aloe vera, baby powder, shea butter). using the ipl (and still shaving any strays) is the only method that has not resulted in pimply and unsightly ingrown hairs. i still use tendskin afterwards and then moisturize as much as possible. (i don't know if its the tendskin, or the moisturizer that now keeps things smooth!). but i am not vexed by ingrown hairs anymore, and the general result is again... pretty slick and smooth.<br /><br />for now, this remington system (which is quite a nicely built machine), with a bit of shaving, and a bit of tendskin then moisturizer (olay 7 effects... who said it's meant only for your face!)... is definitly keeping things nice and smooth... i've tried lots. for now, this is definitely what's working for me best! it is also CONVENIENT. can do it at home when i need and want, and not have to make a salon appointment. some people have said depending on the # of cartridges you use and their life, it's actually as expensive as a salon. but if you think about how you have to schedule life, errands, and time around a salon appointment, i think even if this worked out to the same cost-wise, i'd much rather save the time and avoid the hassle of going to a salon and simply do this at home.<br /><br />overall, not perfect, but pretty pretty good.

  258. I'm a guy who's had professional laser hair removal in the salon to take care of body hair on my chest and arms. So going into at-home IPL hair removal, I at least had an inkling of what to expect. Anyone who's had &#34;real&#34; laser hair removal before will see right away that this unit is a worthless piece of garbage. I felt absolutely no difference in &#34;intensity&#34; between the lowest setting and the highest setting, and no pain at all. Now, I'm no masochist, but in order for a product like this to work, you should be feeling the light zapping your hair follicles. I even tested it on my leg hair, which is very dense, and still no pain. This alone would prove that this product has absolutely nowhere near enough power to actually zap hair follicles. No pain, no redness, no nothing. (I mention the redness because my skin, in addition to being fair, is also very sensitive and would usually redden for a few moments after zapping in the salon -- not so with the Remington.) Also, after repeated use on the same areas-- I'm the ideal candidate by the way (super pale skin, very dark hair), not a SINGLE hair has fallen out.<br /><br />I would advice anyone reading these reviews and considering purchasing this product to look very carefully at the glowing 5-star reviews, and check to see if those customers even have other reviewers, or if they mysteriously only decided to rate this product.<br /><br />Don't make the same mistake I made. Just wax, or epilate, or if you have money to blow, go to a salon and get it done professionally. Sure it's overpriced there and the technicians are usually careless, but at least the areas they zap will actually &#34;get&#34; the hair follicles, unlike the Remington I-Light Pro.
