I only use this on my face on setting five like every other day for 3 weeks n i have no hair on my face anymore. im only using this once or twice a week now. Its amazing, if u want to use it on ur dark facial hair. Only bad thing is it makes ur skin super dry for the first two weeks so use a good moisturizer after using this. I think only setting five works for ur face. Hope this review helps.
  594. I like having a smooth leg, but shaving is such a chore. However, it is the best method of hair removal I've found so far. Waxing just doesn't seem practical to me - you have to grow the hair out to have it pulled out and then it only lasts 2 weeks? Um, no. If I am going through all that, the hair removal better last at least twice as long.<br /><br />I've tried some other hair removal methods - electric shavers and the like, but nothing gets my legs quite as smooth as shaving. I bought a [[ASIN:B000EZYKTS Braun 5270 X'elle Body System Epilator]] once, but it was way too painful to me, so I gave it to my Mother, who loved hers. She had wanted an extra one to keep on the RV anyway.<br /><br />I've always said if I won the lottery I'd have laser hair removal on my legs, under my arms, and on the bikini area. Then I found out that Remington makes a home version of what the doctors use and their kit is much more affordable.<br /><br />I was so excited when my Remington IPL6000USA I-Light Pro, Professional IPL Hair Removal System arrived. I had planned to use it that very week - just as soon as I'd read the manual and watched the handy little instructional DVD it came with. Then I read the part of the manual that warns against using it on \\"damaged skin, including open wounds, cold sores, sunburns...\\" I had just moved not long before I got the Remington I-Light Pro and between that and my normal clumsiness, I had a few scrapes and cuts on my legs. Not only that, but mosquitoes love me, so I had a couple of bites. Apparently finding a time when I have no such wounds on my legs is difficult - at least when I am busy with so many household projects.<br /><br />Finally a time came when everything had healed and I was ready to go. I planned an evening to use the I-Light Pro, showering and shaving again that evening even though I had shaved that morning. The instructions say it works best with clean, dry, freshly shaved areas so I wanted to be sure to prep well.<br /><br />I read the instructions again and found that I wasn't so sure I was understanding exactly how to move the wand around the areas to be zapped. I had anticipated that I would just slide it down my legs, and it would continuously zap the areas as I moved the wand. The manual made it sound like I was mistaken. So I watched the instructional DVD before I started using it. Sure enough, the model on the DVD was holding the wand still on the skin, zapping, then picking it up and moving it just a bit further before holding it still and zapping again. I have to say the DVD was extremely helpful to me.<br /><br />Armed with as much information as possible, I was ready to turn it on. The device goes into a test mode and beeps at you until you hold the area of skin you are wanting to zap over the testing scanner. If the area tests well, then the I-Light Pro activates and a green light indicates you are ready to begin. If the area does not test successfully, the I-Light Pro will not activate and you won't be able to use it. I am a natural brunette with fair, untanned skin, so I tested well. Naturally dark or tanned skin is not recommended, as is people whose natural hair color is light or grey.<br /><br />The manual warns not to overlap, so I recommend paying attention to where you begin your work and make sure you keep paying attention as you progress with the I-Light Pro. I used a freckle on each leg as my starting point so I knew where to stop when I reached the freckle again.<br /><br />When you turn on the device, it automatically sets itself to the lowest energy setting. I started with the highest energy settings, since that is supposed to be most effective. This was fine on most of my legs, but I had to reduce to the middle energy setting for the area behind my knees. I also used the middle setting for my underarms and bikini area.<br /><br />Using the device is really easy. You place the end of the wand completely on your skin. If it doesn't make a proper contact, it won't let you zap that area. The device emits a chirp when a good contact is made and allows you to zap. A working device will not allow you to zap while the wand is in mid-air, for safety reasons.<br /><br />I did feel a little warmth and occasional tingles as I worked, but it wasn't uncomfortable and was over with very quickly.<br /><br />The instructions say that you should use it once every two weeks for three treatments and then use it as needed. After the first treatment, the hair on my knees didn't start growing again for almost two weeks. I'm not sure the hair on my thighs started regrowing at all, but then the hair there has also grown far slower and finer than anywhere else on my body.<br /><br />When I performed the second treatment, I forgot to change the energy setting and used it everywhere on the lowest setting. I realized it later and thought it would be a great feature to make you select an energy level each time you start to prevent using an undesired setting.<br /><br />I have now performed four treatments and can say that I do see a definite decrease in the speed at which my hair grows back although I don't see the effect that I'd hoped for. I don't have to shave my thighs at all anymore and shave my knees about every two weeks. My lower legs need to be shaved about once a week. The I-Light Pro seems least effective under my arms, and I have to shave there about twice a week still.<br /><br />I'll be doing a fifth treatment soon and hope that it will be the one that eliminates shaving for a while. I'll check back in once I've had time to know for sure. If I see more result after the next two treatments, I'll probably raise my star rating.<br /><br />I should add that the cartridge ran out of energy about halfway through my fourth treatment. I have been treating my underarms, full legs, and bikini area each time. I ordered the replacement cartridge ([[ASIN:B005CHHO4Q Remington SP6000SB I-Light Pro, Professional IPL Hair Removal System, Replacement Cartridge]]) from Amazon and picked up where I left off a few days later when it arrived. I'll keep a replacement on hand now so I can finish each treatment rather than wait for an order to arrive. Changing the cartridge was an easy and quick task.t you zap that area. The device emits a chirp when a good contact is made and allows you to zap. A working device will not allow you to zap while the wand is in mid-air, for safety reasons.<br /><br />I did feel a little warmth and occasional tingles as I worked, but it wasn't uncomfortable and was over with very quickly.<br /><br />The instructions say that you should use it once every two weeks for three treatments and then use it as needed. After the first treatment, the hair on my knees didn't start growing again for almost two weeks. I'm not sure the hair on my thighs started regrowing at all, but then the hair there has also grown far slower and finer than anywhere else on my body.<br /><br />When I performed the second treatment, I forgot to change the energy setting and used it everywhere on the lowest setting. I realized it later and thought it would be a great feature to make you select an energy level each time you start to prevent using an undesired setting.<br /><br />I have now performed four treatments and can say that I do see a definite decrease in the speed at which my hair grows back although I don't see the effect that I'd hoped for. I don't have to shave my thighs at all anymore and shave my knees about every two weeks. My lower legs need to be shaved about once a week. The I-Light Pro seems least effective under my arms, and I have to shave there about twice a week still.<br /><br />I'll be doing a fifth treatment soon and hope that it will be the one that eliminates shaving for a while. I'll check back in once I've had time to know for sure. If I see more result after the next two treatments, I'll probably raise my star rating.<br /><br />I should add that the cartridge ran out of energy about halfway through my fourth treatment. I have been treating my underarms, full legs, and bikini area each time. I ordered the replacement cartridge ([[ASIN:B005CHHO4Q Remington SP6000SB I-Light Pro, Professional IPL Hair Removal System, Replacement Cartridge]]) from Amazon and picked up where I left off a few days later when it arrived. I'll keep a replacement on hand now so I can finish each treatment rather than wait for an order to arrive. Changing the cartridge was an easy and quick task.

Before shipping the item, I decided to try one last time and to my surprise, it started working like nothing was wrong. SO I did not send the item back and would like to apologies for my first review. still do not have any explanation about what did really happened....   596. I only wish it worked faster! I have had this item for a couple months, so I've gone through three cycles. I also use it on my bikini area, legs, underarms, and boyfriend's back! Great little device. Be sure to shave thoroughly prior to use.   597. I see many of people expect that it can remove hairs permanently (Like me when I bought it), but results are not permanent. In the first two months that you use it, you will see great result (based on how you cover all the spots of your skin)... but right now after 6 months of the first use (for two months), I have almost 90% of my hairs back...<br /><br />So be aware: \\"It doesn't remove hairs permanently... You need to use it for a life time to call it a permanent hair removal system!...\\"

  600. Got the item about 6 weeks ago and so far I am very satisfied. I decided to do certain areas first and then work on other ones instead of doing full body treatments all in one sessions. I like doing it this way. In the long run it's taking alot longer but I'm able to keep track of progress and not have to spend 45 minutes or more per session. The pain is very minimal. I use the highest setting and I hardly feel it except on my underarms where the hair is a bit thicker. Just did my 3rd treatment today and I think it's working great. The hair is growing much slower and has become thinner for sure...even a couple patches where the hair is gone altogether. I'm thinking within the next two weeks most areas will be hair free if the progress continues. Overall good product and I would suggest it to others.

  602. First off just want to let everyone know that i am a guy and i am using this product from my neck to my waste line.<br /><br />first treatment:<br /><br />I shaved with a regular razor as directed and did my first session. I did it on the highest voltage and Im not going to lie it hurts. I have a very high pain tolerance and for some reason it feels like someone is snapping a rubber-band on my stomach and chest as hard as they can. I had a horrible reaction on my chest and it was from just shaving. I had ingrown hairs all over and they were very annoying. I recommend that you shave your body with clippers because that never gives me ingrown hairs. After the first couple of days went by and i was ready for my second treatment i didn't notice any change and my hair was growing back as normal.<br /><br />Second treatment:<br /><br />Since my chest broke out so bad i decided to just do my stomach area and upper abdomen. I used clippers and didn't get any ingrown hairs this time. It still hurt like a son of a bi*ch. I noticed that my hair wasn't growing back as thick and as quickly.<br /><br />Third Treatment:<br /><br />I did my third treatment on my stomach and second treatment on my chest today. I still have bumps on my chest from shaving with a razor the first time and used clippers this time and don't feel like i will have a bad reaction again. I am still using the intensity on high and it wasn't as painful as the first two times. I feel like some areas are having results but overall nothing is really happening. It says that you are suppose to do it 3 times in the first 2 weeks and then it should be hair free for 6 months and only touch up will be necessary. I highly doubt this will occur and i am going to try and call costumer support as the video directs to try and find a solution.<br /><br />Ill try and keep you guys updated and it was hard finding a review on males using this product so i felt i had to share my experience. Overall i would not recommend this product just yet. Ill let you guys know if i change my mind within the next couple of weeks.

  609. I purchased this machine in March. I had a small issue that the box had been opened. I contacted the seller and he assured me the unit was new, unused. As a courtesy he refunded $40.00 because the box had been opened. I did my first treatment the end of March and each additional treatment 2-3 weeks apart. I have preformed 4 treatments and the results have been very encouraging. I have 60-70% less hair. I have treated my legs, both top and bottom, my underarms and my bikini line. The light that came with the machine gave me 3 full treatments. I think more than the 1500 pulses that is usually the life span of the light. But than I had less luck with my replacement lights. I did not buy the replacement light from this seller so he is not responsible for this. You can read my reviews for them by going to that link. I am discouraged by the replacement lights but very encouraged by the machine. And I would completely recommend this seller.

I have had professional laser hair removal on my legs, and this is not as good as that, but it is doing a slow but steady job of removing my unwanted hair. I have had no problems with the flash cartridge.
  611. This is me and my girls new best friend. I had laser treatments for years and this works just as well. Very sensitive to darker skin color. It will not work if you are tan or dark. Works terrific and on my terms! I love it!
